sCVYeH91tcbHTdJyIcz8ig.text: Finding a good, reasonably priced steak in London is an ongoing challenge - no more!  Very simple, very stylish, very friendly place (even though sundae machine was broken when we visited....heartbroken...will have to go back).  Can't wait to go back...probably weekly...and they do owe me that sundae.....Cocktails were very nice too - all reasonably priced.

6A-qtaLK1No92c5tKyxW9Q.text: Best meal in London.  I would suggest the steak and the Burger, but that is all that is on the menu!  The queue can take some time, however they are happy to take your name and call you when your time has come.  Great meal, great service.

9pGMolp1g5_dGyj118RA5g.text: Quick, good quality steak dinner for a reasonable price.Plus they give you a very cool little meat cleaver to cut your steak.

h7XtDa2s5_86pXoC_jlOiQ.text: In my stay in London, I did not have too many authentic English food - - however, I had a few delicious and memorable meals. Flat iron was one of those meals. The concept is simple and fantastic, and the steak is very affordable. The menu only has steak, and you only select how you want the steak cooked. Next, you choose the sauce and sides to go with the steak. Finally, you get your food and enjoy! The kicker is that the knives to cut the steak are adorable mini butcher knives. Coupled with the homely decor, and you have yourself a cute date.My tip for any takers is to go early. There can be a long wait, and even at a relatively early time,  we still had to wait 40 minutes. Luckily, there are a few bars very close by, so passing time wasn't too difficult. If offered a chance to return to London, I would definitely come by again.

gxRbL8OmTd1xxgxBD0FAqw.text: The peppercorn sauce was great! So was the fries. Everything goes really well with the steak which was juicy and tender. Really affordable price too, for steak in the central part of london. I always wanted to try this place but was daunted by the long queues for a long time. Finally went with some friends and we arrived early (for dinner) so the wait was only a little more than half-hour. So all was good.Regrettably I am not giving it 5 stars because my friend's steak came a little more rare than mine even though we all ordered medium rare. Also, the salted popcorns were too salty.

UStqirg1VCobcTTJmTsfsw.text: So I used to be a pescetarian but Gaucho and this place converted me back to meat-eating. Sorry animals. But seriously, delicious succulent, buttery steak for a tenner! Their cut of meat obviously isn't the prime but at this price, you can pop in whenever you fancy a good steak.Small portion size but it's actually a good thing for greedy ladies who are trying to eat sensibly. Side dishes are also lovely and very reasonably priced. Their house red is perfectly drinkable too. I love it!

L0JidAKu9RKgoygaVNALYA.text: Small, quaint... busy!A really nice steak house in Soho. We turned up and they were really busy about 6pm but managed to seat us, the seating is like sitting in a canteen like you would in school on those foldable tables, but these are wooden, OK! I'm not selling this very well. Basically be prepared to sit close to people you don't know and on stool like seating fixed to the floor.They serve popcorn as soon as you sit down, ok.. different and the beers are nice and cold so.. sorted!The menu, to my knowledge, only had two steaks... we both had the Flat Iron steaks... really nice, how do I want it cooked? Medium.. was it medium? Yes.Chips were great, service was nice... great for a quick meal and catch up.Please see my pictures...

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Flat Iron steak

sKt6hsvhzi4DsVhsbbq4pA.text: Popular place so prepared for long waits.  Really good considering the price. The steak is a little small but it's also only £10.  Our waitress was friendly, and the house wine is pretty cheap.  Overall a good dining experience, and I would return.  The only complaint is the same as others - the mini meat cleaver is cool, but actually does a pretty bad job of cutting the steak as it lacks teeth - good thing the £10 steak is mostly cut up already.

csIhyGq0Knk9E1tGe4zoFA.text: The steak was very good with the bernaise sauce. We also ordered the chips and other sides. They have very few dishes (the only main is steak), but what they do they do well. The food is on the oily side. I enjoyed the rustic atmosphere.

cKhCIhoQRQXJhNaSGKTCSg.text: Great little steak restaurant. I go here whenever I'm visiting London for business meetings. Long wait so get your name in the list early and enjoy a pint nearby while you wait. Menu is limited but everything is delicious. Definitely try the aubergine and spinach side dishes with your steady. Popcorn snack they give as soon as you sit down is the bomb.

QQrRKrI-YCW1WXQyu_oYlg.text: Beef is my weakness, so Flat Iron is heaven for me.... How do you have your steak? I have it medium/rare, and often I am thinking this is a bit too bleeding and moo moo for my liking, or on the flip side, too well done, too chewy. Flat Iron really do get the medium/rare just right, and the menu is real simple.You can order your standard Flat Iron steak (usually £10) or the special cut for the day (around £15). Than your sides, choice of chips and various greens. Try out the Roast aubergine, tomato and basil. goes perfect with a forkfull of steak and chips. Sauces are your standard steak accompaniments such as Bearnaise, Horseradish cream, Peppercorn and Fred's sauce.. which has bit more of a kick.. They are all reasonably priced, so being the pig, or in this case, cow I am, I will have two, to myself ! Wines are simple to order as you can get it by the glass, carafe or bottle. I am usually too stuffed for dessert, so that will be left for my next time... maybe when I visit their Denmark Street branch.Oh yeah, you gotta go cos you get a mini cleaver in place of your knife !

Lljc1fbjbG_C9k-LFcmcQQ.text: Nice on a full night to find an empty bar seating.   Flat Iron steak was nicely done service was friendly (though they forgot the greens salad),  a great bargain and for 10 quid

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Medium flat iron
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Empty bar seating

gfn4F2AJwE_NyQ0znr1ggw.text: Picanha melts in your mouth. 'Regular' steak is superlative too. All sides were lovely. Well worth a visit!

M6k6XhPnJ386UKD5n5cLUg.text: This is an intimate restaurant on Beak St, which specialises in flat iron steak. From time to time, they also offer a special steak (when I was there, they were doing a NZ wagyu steak). They do nothing else except for the usual sides.I have a nice feeling about this place. I don't think you can make a booking, but you can pop in to register your name on a virtual queue. Be prepared for a long wait if you are a group. Obviously it is much easier to find space if there is one or two of you.I had the steak which they usually offer for £10, done medium rare. This is what the lady recommended, so I thought I would delegate that decision to her. I got a side of chips (what else?) and the steak already comes with a token salad. I asked for horseradish too.It came out fairly quickly. This is a smooth operation. I like how the steak is already sliced into bite-sized morsels and I managed to eat the whole meal, casual-style, with fork in right hand, left hand on the table. Get some horseradish on the fork, spread it on the steak, place it on my mouth. I love it when the heat from the horseradish slowly permeates from your mouth up through your sinuses.I was pleased with the meal: it filled a hole in my stomach and was good value. The people there are friendly without seeming too rehearsed. I'll come back again, when I feel like a steak, but not the full-on experience of the bigger steak restaurants.

fGUpyQ8lP3RRIND0N5nB8A.text: Great steak for £10 with salad and a side of chips. It's cheap but the quality of your meal goes beyond the price tag. Don't bring your vegetarian friends here as they have little to no veggie options, but other than that, full marks for a affordable and tasty meal.

s2QPiO6Hrnyt-f6ELe3AjQ.text: I can safely say that this is the best value for money steak place in London. For only £10 you get a nice portion of Flat Iron steak. I have mine rare and they always get it spot on without the blood oozing out.The steak is so flavoursome, juicy and tender that I don't usually have a sauce with it. However, do order the aubergine bake which goes so nicely with the meat.Only downside is that it does get very busy, especially for dinner, and there is often a bit of a wait.

0AzT24grRRdBmVXhTVc93Q.text: Pretty good except for one fatal flaw, I ordered my steak medium rare, and it came out well done....dry.   we came in 30 minutes prior to close so they wouldn't do it again for me. Will have to try again next visit to london, I know they can get it right

m3noeAoGHOAnoC15xY4vww.text: By far the best bar ive been to in London. Possibly ever? there are plants everywhere and modern furniture. the bartenders were super nice and conversational. they were very trained and made all the drinks perfectly. loved this place and t was super cheap too!

owhOXd9l25rGgrVUdZoNqQ.text: In a world of so many choices, sometimes it's just brilliant to not really have any to keep life simple.  After hearing so much about this place, I was a little worried attempting to go for dinner on a Saturday night.  It was approximately a 2 hour wait.  Looking around other restaurants with the amount of heaving Christmas shoppers, we figured any place would be a wait so decided to stick it through.  There's a nice bar downstairs, which could probably use the space a little better as I found it much more enjoyable to sit down there waiting for a drink rather than the cramped seats upstairs.  Anyway, it was good to discover that they had hot doughnuts!  Well, we were seated an hour earlier than expected so lucky us that a bunch of other people put their name down and didn't show up.  Steak was surprisingly really good.  I had the secret sauce which tasted like a bunch of other sauces mixed together.  Also had a side of chips, green beans and roasted aubergine (YUM!) which were all pretty good.  Service was really friendly - a couple of times they forgot what we ordered like an additional diet coke but got it straight away for us.  There's only one dessert which is this chocolate caramel mousse thing - I think it comes out of a piping bag where the cream is whipped.  They give you a side of salt if you prefer the salted caramel kinda thing.  It was good but super rich.  I opted to go downstairs and pick up a doughnut!This'll definitely be my go to casual steak place.

aT9P5wHvfkt9-pHEZPbyGA.text: Flatiron basically does one dish, and does it very well, for a very acceptable price. A beautiful cut of steak, tender and perfectly seasoned, with yummy crispy chips and a side salad, and also an excellent bearnaise sauce. For the relatively low price of about £15 excluding drinks, it's a lovely place to have steak in central London. Does not take reservations, but turnover is quite fast and they will take your number and call you if you want to go for a wander then return.  This venue is better than the Denmark Street one because it is slightly less noisy when it's busy.

qQaWPGvbIOZaZabh2ux0fw.text: My husband and I came here because of the good reviews. We loved it! The steak was delish and we would come again for sure.

o2-uzxP0ra1nJcgLRIaCgg.text: Great food amazing value and I love the butcher knifes they give you with your steaks. You can't beat the food or the price. We should up they told us a 1/2 hour and the table was ready in 20 minutes.

OfYaHsUgdNDRI9lx_dbc4Q.text: One item on the menu cos they know it's good! The roasted aubergine is to die for and the steak medium rare is delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Steak and Veggie of the day

vZS5yXEeWjMtXKAq7Q6gLA.text: Such good steak for such good price. I don't think anyone can beat this in london. Be prepared to leave with a smoky smell.. at least you know your meat is being prepared right there and then on the spot!

SVw48xmTua4c6VI1pWSWWA.text: Meal was great and reasonably priced. Had the creamed spinach, the steak and the eggplant dish.

-ND5BBgVUWjlwFMPaZH5aQ.text: This place totally exceeded our expectations. We were greeted by a very nice host at the door. The wait was about 10 mins on a Monday night (around 6 PM), so that was fine. Waitress was lovely - enthusiastic, informative and gave a great service. Free water was already at the table and was refreshed even after we finished our food. Steaks were of good quality and cooked to perfection. Béarnaise sauce just right, fries were fresh. Just one side note: house salad consists of just spinach with a dressing, could've been better. Will order a veggie side next time. Oh and the (free!) chocolate ice cream is to die for. 5 stars well deserved!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

EyrkI2ps2KquhTO9Y6UQzg.text: This place has been on my list for ages so New Years Day my dreams came true and we wondered over to this branch for a late lunch. It was Amaaaaazing. We were lucky to be seated within a few minutes as I've tried to go before and there has been an hour and a half wait.We both went for one of their bottled beers (£4 each and both good ale) and ordered a steak and their special (steak burger) with chips and creamed spinach.Food came out in a good amount of time. The steak was cooked perfectly and the burger was delish, nice bun (don't normally like seeded buns but this was great), great sauce, well cooked. Chips were crisp and fluffy - delish - and the creamed spinach was rich and gorgeous.Amazing value for £10 each main and £3 for each side. Service was good - friendly and efficient although she forgot the Mayo (not really needed). The only thing which means it isn't 5* from me is the seating. They have shared benches with fixed stools with no back. A bit uncomfy and cramped as well as a little awkward when only 2 of you next to a group of 4.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

gqu2xxvPZ_qgn7DjFy0rkw.text: One of the best dining experiences. Food was amazing but simple. I'd recommend the bernaise and peppercorn sauce to dip with your fires and steak! The creamed spinach was eaten up by my boyfriend who would normally cringe at that. Tom our waiter was helpful, attentive and so friendly! The wait staff, fellow patrons and the whole establishment are a reason to add this to the top of your list!

IQWEV50HlVbxdshW0uj8NQ.text: This place simply suits someone wanting simplicity in a flavorful package. Choice red meat, an impeccable old fashioned, perfectly done fresh chips, quick service and a butcher steak knife. I'd come here every week if I lived here.

7kzbD_NGmgvMQK_j7ymlvg.text: Luckily we got there before the rush so we only had to wait 30-45 minutes whereas others had to wait up to two hours o_o They will also text you when your table is ready.But once we got in, service was fast, efficient, and friendly. The food was great! My steak was so good, and also those chips were totally worth it mmmmmm I loved those. Pretty affordable, so A+ good job!

C4R06Iwcr6sQy1nGzSffnw.text: I've been here twice. The house steak for £10 was delicious with its small salad. The fries cooked in beef dripping are the best. Portions aren't huge but quality... right? My 2nd visit was a hamburger which I would never get again. The patty was way to  small and there was no taste of meat for all the rich sauce. It was to much and left me feeling a bit sick later. A hamburger has to emphasis the meat and I'm surprised they didn't nail this. Service was quick. Get there before 17:30 or no chance. Free ice cream is a bonus I greatly appreciated.

YsCWoMogrY--3EN8YHbchg.text: Excellent meat! Good service, don't be discouraged by the waiting list. Try the Fred's sauce. The special burger is amazing

05sGVmZmCBreNNddpMbXrA.text: Wonderful concept. The only steak on the regular menu is a flat iron, and absolutely delicious and overlooked cut when cooked right. And it's cheap, 10 pounds with a small salad.The ambiance is great and the staff are kind. The sides are very good, I always get the market vegetables. I also love the delicious buttery popcorn brought out for free with the menu.The steak is not well seared enough, however. Even for medium rare, a very good steakhouse can use high temperature to get a perfect sear. Flat Iron doesn't and definitely misses out on some flavor. If it was a 30 pound steak it'd be a big problem. For 10 pounds it doesn't merit a star deduction.

qFjrfmHET9Ts6xbSzmVjRA.text: 4 of us went for dinner and we had heard pretty decent things about this restaurant (not to mention the 4.5 stars on Yelp).  This place is known for the £10 steak.  It was tiny!  Somehow, one plate looked completely different from the other.  One portion actually looked half decent while the other 3 looked limp and sad.  Consistency, zero.  Two of us also ordered the £15 "special".  What an up sell that was.  It was actually thinner (a skirt steak of some sort) than their regular flat iron.  Did it taste better?  Not really.Now please don't start telling me, "What do you expect for £10-£15?"  Well, I'm pretty disappointed that we weren't served anything that looked like the pictures we've seen!!!   This place certainly didn't live up to the 1.5 hour wait time.  To the people who did suggest this place, it may have been good when you tried it last but unfortunately, our experience was less than sub-par.  Do not return nor recommend in the future.  I rarely give one star reviews but this place does not deserve anything more.  Save your time (and £10) and go elsewhere!

GHdT6AY_T5ELastfIvEk_A.text: For a first timer, the steak was half yummy and half salty. I was a little disappointed at how small the steak was compared to american ones. The free popcorn was pretty yummy and the service was fairly fast. I tried their house fizz that barely had the beverage and had more ice in the cup. The price of the steak was pretty fair. I even ordered the burger which was more filling than the steak.

LPkdnNGNGXS4OcKEiUyumQ.text: Finally got to try this place, and because I went for lunch I think I got the best service as there was no queue at all (in fact we were seated downstairs -lovely room- and we were the first ones. It was 12pm). The ambience is very nice, your seat is equipped with a tiny meat cleaver (which you don't really need if you get the classic flat iron, as it comes already sliced) and tap lemony water is served without asking. There is a big board with the specials of the day - which nearly tempted me into trying the Wagyu Picanha (I drool if I as much as think about it). But alas, diet. And also I thought the first time I should really try their famous classic so I went for the flat iron steak. I also ordered a side of fennel & nectarine salad, never thought they could work together but it was so tasty!The steak itself came medium rare, and I was pleasantly surprised to see that it was actually medium rare! I could see the difference between my friend's steak which was just medium, and my other friend's steak that was rare-blue. So kudos to them for knowing their meat. (You'd think that's a prerogative for steak houses, unfortunately that isn't always the case...)We shared a bottle of wine and I've since been trying to remember the name of it as it was VERY good, and I don't usually drink red. It was light and tasty. Complimented the meat perfectly.Will definitely be back, hopefully NOT for dinner as I hear the queue can get quite intense (and I can see why!).

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

VH8QMayT2oUY91xTB9OYdw.text: Go-to place for steak in London. Good food and very affordable. Steak costs just £10!! Doesn't get better than that. Oh I almost forgot, the peppercorn sauce is EVERYTHING!

JEg0opcKj6hmNsDx7CMSYg.text: Limited menu but that is the point. The steaks are cheap cuts with the sous vide cooking method, and the flavor/tenderness is fantastic! Possibly the best fries (chips) I've ever had as they are made with beef fat. Thoroughly enjoyed the Blood Orange Old Fashioned too. All around amazing place and worth the wait.

_ZuakdotTs_hEK03SRgLHQ.text: Had one of the greatest steaks I've ever had here for quite cheap considering the area, the basement bar is also awesome for a drink while waiting for a table. Will definitely be coming here again next time I'm in London!

fIyrpzuIgzqFeWQS-cgaTA.text: If you want to have the best steak in London, with the best price ever, you have to visit Flat Iron. Flat steak is the one and only menu (sometimes they offer sirloin and hamburger) but the Flat Iron is the best. Well served, excellent service and finish with the best Salted Caramel cone ever...highly recommended! They do not take reservations, so plan your day in advance to take your place and an hour and a half to 2 hour wait...believe me, it is worth the wait!!!

EvaJXLIy8X9-v29FJWc1Yg.text: Fantastic steak at extremely competitive prices, no need for a long winded review just try this place!

nhJ3_wR1ZxxzfPi_F90Wxg.text: I've been here twice before. However, I would say their service has deteriorated drastically and I am highly reluctant to be back again. I brought my friend here aiming to introduce to her one of my fav steak restaurants and ordered the flat iron steak (medium well). The steak turned out to be well-done with its surface already hardened. We signaled the waiter to change for us, but instead of understanding why we wanna change it, he rudely threw out the sentence "I WILL CHANGE FOR YOU. HOW DO U WANT IT DONE" to refuse any communication. His "I am sorry" seems super insincere and irritating for someone with high expectation of the service here. He's acting like 'as long as I can change it for you, what the fuck are you complaining about'. This is indeed the WORST dining service I've ever received in London. Totally not worth the money judging from the service and food quality (How can a steak house and its staff get confused with the difference between medium well and well done?! I just don't get it!). If u r looking for good steak in time, go somewhere else where they give u the right thing u order and some respect!

MFPMwEZJKsv4jfckpqarhA.text: Great food price balance. Steak , fries, burger , salad and sauces ....everything was tasteful, steak was as medium and pink as it should be, Fries thick and burger juicy :-) definitely worth visiting when you are hungry.

2NEuK4x6jLob1kGPuoAhuQ.text: An affordable high quality and tasty way to add some flavor to your evening with a "little" steak and attentive service. It is worth the wait.

KsrHEMoDZAFOhveXy5Wgsg.text: Bang average. They don't do bookings do we were waiting for almost two hours for a birthday table of 8 (birthday boy was desperate to eat here on recommendation) liked the simplicity of the flat iron steak yes sauces were great, potentially the best part. They have a 'secret sauce' which apparently changes from time to time which complimented the peppercorn & bernaise well I thought. However no word of a lie, 8 hungry lads after a few beers we had two rounds of steak-it was simply too small. So 2 steaks, a bottle of red between 4 and 2 potions of chips and sauces etc. came to £40 which is not expensive for the heart if Soho. However the portions were simply too small if you want a decent steak. Nice enough for a one off, probably would recommend it and now I've done it I probably won't go back! Not bad at all, just far better places all over London to be honest! Average.

F6aC-Gd2NbUxM575w9XN0g.text: Loved it, loved it, loved it.  What's not to love?  Went at 5:15.  Was told 40 min wait but turned out to only be 20.   Delicious steaks, excellent pricing, delicious sides, delicious dessert, nice wine.  Had the signature flat iron last night along with fries, spinach, broccoli and chocolate mousse.  Horseradish sauce and Fred's sauce both good. Tariff $100 usd without alcohol.  Open all day, year round except Christmas.  Will definitely return.

FRYROZHGA110zR_eB6uADw.text: Love this place.Such a simple idea, but masterfully executed and great value for money.  If you are not a patient eater, it is not for you at peak times, as we had to wait around an hour for a table for two.  Definitely worth the wait.The flat iron steak was cooked to perfection and very tender. The presentation was great also.The sides were delectable.  Amazing fries, perfect spinach.I would highly recommend

76kY1-LIUh3PqqyYJbX32g.text: Delicious red meat at affordable prices. A rare find. Intimate decor but not so intimate conversations as you will be sat in whatever spot is available - seems to be a new trend given limited spacing in London Restaurants. They pay attention to detail (you will be greeted with some popcorn) and very friendly staff that you will make are you have anything you need. A must. Portions could be bigger...

zBP65FT4mLiN9sWqUW-bmA.text: ok, i just came back from London today and had to share about this place.  after such raving reviews and dying for a good steak on our trip, we went around London looking for this place because we were too ghetto to buy a new sim card for our phones.  FYI. this place is only a stone throw away on a street right off of the main Regent Street.  another hint is when you find Brook Brothers on Regent, that tiny street corner is Beak street and walk another 30 seconds and you will see Flat Iron on your right.  the restaurant is super, duper tiny with 3 levels.  they take your name and number and text you when your table is ready.  very helpful!  what i noticed the most were the million asian faces walking in and out of the restaurants.  apparently, this place has been heavily blogged by other asians and they all seem to love it.  so, our wait was over an hour and we burned it on Regent and rushed back once we got the text.  our family all ordered their steaks and the price was GBP10 just as advertised.  the cut was small and served on a iron/wood tray with micro green salad. the sauce, fries or other stuff are all extras.  the service was quick, good and the food was pretty good.  remember, i am a serious foodie from the US, the land of super good food at a much better price than London. so, i am pretty tough on rating anything as good or even great.  this place is good because of quality of food, service and price.  on this occasion, i ordered some cream spinach as a side to my medium rare steak.  the meat was tender and it was correctly medium rare. it is usually over done and most steaks are rarely done correctly to order.   BUT, the spinach had a piece of hair in it on my second bite.   YIKES!!  i told our server and she handed it well and offered another side.  if she had been a jerk or dismissed it, i would have reacted accordingly.  she brought over her manager/owner to let me know how sorry they were and they reduced my portion of the bill to make up for the problem without me having to even ask.  they handled it very professionally and i was very glad they knew how to take care of business.  before i walked out, i thanked the manager and told her i really enjoyed the experience.  as you can read from my other reviews, i do NOT compliment easily or give out high stars easily.  this place seems to respect their customers and does not seem jaded by their success.  kudos to them for doing a great job!!!  :-)

Z2SiQFVhSBGkIidSr_3mqQ.text: Heard good reviews so went there after a 12 hour workday arriving at around 9, only to be greeted by unfriendly staff that said it would at least be a 2 hour wait. A glance at the box of buzzers however revealed only 4 of them were out, they clearly did not want to serve us so we went elsewhere. Will stop at a steakhouse near work next time to save myself the disappointment !

9oO4czjKSqrYt3S8jYP-NA.text: Big props for this single-menu-item place. Steak cut was small but deliciously tasty, expertly cooked and insanely good value. Burger was on special, but the meat taste was overpowered by a weird sweet bernaise sauce. Clattery atmosphere, elbow nudging and lean in shouting matches. Would definitely go again!

cppL25UMQq10i-qUD6Mr-g.text: althought they have shared tables at flat iron, its not an issue, im a massive beef fan, and my personel fav is the irish beef belly special, perfectly cooked! the service is great, and the food is even better, would defiantly reccomend

wmdjv2x0yGZ1LKFrVt40xg.text: Small outfit, really friendly staff, simple menu. Arrived at 5pm since we were shopping around the area, seated right away. My kid loved their hamburger and the medium rare flat iron steak with horseradish dip was very good as well. In and out within 40 minutes.

NJe7h-vf6j7dGgJymoPLtg.text: After wandering to too many pubs and bars with mediocre and overpriced food, we stimbled upon this gem. The place is fairly small, and there will be a wait even late night(we went there around 9pm?), however you can wait downstairs at the bar and they tend to have a happy hour deal anyways. The steak was done fairly well, and the fries they had here were probably the best I've had in London (most of the fries I had were soggy/reheated or old tasting). These fries tasted as if they were fresh from the fryer! They were nice and soft on the inside with a crispy outer. I would recommend this place for small group(ie. two pple), as it is fairly small and you'll share the table with others there.

B6c3LmtOvKHPGtUPhhZZ8Q.text: The food is amazing with the price of 10! And the servants are all very nice!

R-qn91Xw5XsnHZfu6NsB5g.text: Super cool servers and staff, excellent steak and sides, killer dipping sauces.  And all this for reasonable prices in London of all places.  Go with their regular steak and not the special they offer.  The special cut was a bit gamy and undercooked.

CwAU-SJZOzDXgFQDbNDMkA.text: 2.5 hour wait so we walked around and then decided to go back after about 90 minutes.  waited another hour enjoying bloody orange old fashioneds in the downstairs basement bar.  enjoyed that.  steak was worth the wait, and common table seating lets you make some new friends while you eat.worth every second and pound.

HPopBzTnxdZqPslBJLnHQg.text: Had the flat iron steak medium rare as was recommended. I chose no sauce so I could taste the quality of the meat.  I enjoyed my meal, especially for the price.  Not a huge chunk of meat, but perfect not to overinduldge.  The tables are setup with 6 seats each, so you are likely to share a table with a couple other parties if there are only one or two of you. Theres probably about 40 seats in the restaurant.  I came in alone for a late lunch around 3pm, knowing from other reviews that it gets quite busy and was seated immediately, though saw groups of 2 requiring a short wait immediately after.  Since it was a lunch and I was alone, I didn't order any sides and just enjoyed a few bites of the free popcorn to start and the greens the steak came with.  I would definitely come back with a friend and order some of the sides.  But what I really would like to try is there burger.  Not sure if its offered everyday, or only on special, but it seemed to be popular.

_Y52IYHQb4iUBshmB6SfyA.text: Celebrated my friends birthday here a few weeks ago, both food and service was amazing! Will definitely be returning on my next visit to London!

g3zZ--afYczTC8UHkLqwoQ.text: Very cosy environment offering very tasty meat... very very good ... I just hate that it's always packed and have to wait for over an hour to get a table.. pity but once we're in it's great and the good food makes me forget the wait. I love going there with friends !

OL44TWeJ1FAzQD2-NZIIYw.text: Really great steak, yummy salad.  Yummy cocktails (if you wait downstairs in the bar).  I can't say much different than the other reviews, the steak is amazing.  But I could have easily eaten 2 sets of steak, though I was being thy girl and only ordered one.  But the price is reflective of the portion size, not crazy.  I am kicking myself for trying to play like I am a dainty girl who can't knock back 2 sets of steak when I totally could.  DAMN.  Guess I have to go back....

bA0ZW0cEIK1c7dA8CkrilQ.text: Nice little hidden gem just off the high street, nice staff and the steak is to die for

myUEG46nJsAX9VeWX5SY-Q.text: Love the food! Steak are delicious and cooked to perfection. The wine complimented it wonderfully and the secret sauce was a good tip from the waitress. The concept of the mousse dessert was brilliant and they even told me how to make them at home. Best of All... It's pretty cheap, 2 courses, wine and cocktails for 2 of us for £60. Also loved the cleaver knives. Nice touch.

edb_SnY_pecRLXnV5RtJPw.text: Loved this place! Cute and quirky right in the centre of Soho. Walking distance from Piccadilly Circus, we got here about 6pm and waited for a table downstairs in the bar for about half an hour. Just in time for happy hour they have a great range of drinks and cocktails and serve their wine by the carafe. For food, they had a choice of their regular flat iron steak or special top side cut. My boyfriend and I ordered one of each, goose fat fries each, blue cheese and candy pecan salad, and baked aubergine with parmesan all to share. We got both steaks medium rare (recommended). The flat iron was great but personally the topside was a little overcooked but still good. Great atmosphere with a live band and shared seating arrangement. Staff were excellent and prices were really good, especially for area (about £20 each including drinks and tip). Cannot wait to go back with some friends! Yum!!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Flat iron and top side special steak
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Goose fat chips and Sophie's salad
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Flat iron and special topside steak plus sides

-XtzKEDn8JdtOlpq9DWdVA.text: Such a good deal. The steak was delicious and tender--it felt like a steal at £10.  I ordered the steak medium-rare and it was perfectly cooked.  I also ordered the peppercorn sauce (£1) on the side, at the recommendation of the waitress.  Definitely a great add!  The steak was a good size for me--it wasn't not huge, but it's a very good serving size and seemed very high quality.  It was really fun to eat it with the small cleaver knife.  I also appreciated that it was partially pre-cut (probably an effort on the restaurant's part to try and speed up turnover).  Each steak is served with a small side salad. Order fries on the side though--they're great to dip into the sauce!   My husband and I visited Flat Iron for lunch around 1pm.  There was a 30-40 minute wait -- definitely a lot of fellow tourists. The restaurant texts you when your table is ready, which I personally prefer as it lets you wander a bit.  We went to stroll and stop in the shops on Carnaby Street.  We were seated in the basement, which was quite dark but well decorated. The seating was bench style (long table, but individual stool seats), we were seated in between two other parties on a bench made to fit six.  It was definitely uncomfortable to be seated that close to the folks on either side. As a New Yorker I understand though that to offer a meal for such a deal, you have to give some things up.  In this case, it was personal space.  There were definitely some tables that were better, but it seems to be luck of the draw where you end up.  After ordering we probably waited about 20-25 minutes for our steaks.  I was a little surprised it took that long given they have so few menu items, but it wasn't a large inconvenience. I've been to fancy steakhouses back in New York, but nothing compares to the value of the steak here.  I would definitely return to Flat Iron on future trips to London, but would probably aim to go at an off time to avoid the crowds and hopefully score a more comfortable table.

dr_J2cbA0_DAZzjNAxBLdw.text: It is good quality and cheap!!!!around 15 pounds and you got delicious steak.

wYT-0UJZ2vm_u_2Q2_jBGw.text: Fucking awesome steak. Medium rare with salt and pepper the sauce is just bonus on an already amazing piece of meat.

RYtRdy_Yqp0CvLLT_619OQ.text: Great steak!!!  Prepared perfectly.  Just the right amount.  Tried the Bernaise and the peppercorn sauces with it and both were great.  Very reasonably priced for then quality!  Will definite come back here when back in London!

ys-Ok_k2tjFnp-EsfoFplg.text: A really simple menu (flat iron steak or special of the day) + side salad for a 10er. The meat is fantastic! Great choice in sides too (I love the aubergine). All in all, it's great quality, cheap, laid back & no fuss! You do have to wait a while (no res policy) so I'd recommend going in 2's to ensure you get in faster... but take advantage of the downstairs bar whilst you do wait!

BTjzuWFdQIrXynrAwGL6PA.text: The food here is incredible, some of the best steak I have ever had! The service is fast and efficient, the staff friendly and it is really reasonably priced. Only downside is that if you don't get there early and it is busy (especially during weekends), you may have to wait up to an hour or longer for a table space!

5gHdEdTeFI6w4osDjYnsjw.text: Great steak and a great environment. This is an affordable meal that taste pretty expensive. We were a party of 4 visiting the UK looking to sit down and have dinner in a Saturday night which is impossible in this neighborhood without reservations. There was a 2.5 hr wait in que but the host was very helpful and contacted the other location which was about a 15 minute walk away to set up a reservation for our party. By the time we got to the second location our table was ready. The meal was great and our waitress was amazing. The cocktails were okay but I'd suggest ordering a glass or bottle of wine with your meal. They also serve popcorn as an appetizer which was unique but it was freshly popped and seasoned to perfection just like the steaks we ordered.

z4kx8moaDaittF3Jc2nUlg.text: Yes Yes Yes! I went with two friends who are rather fussy diners when it comes to their steaks and they were super impressed with the quality and price of this place! The steaks were melt in your mouth amazing, the chips were crunchy, which I love, and we didn't actually have to wait too long for service (but this could be because we went at 8.30 and got a table for 9.00PM. Definitely worth a trip!

M3m6TyaR_3GR8gZ-jyMD3w.text: Just reading the reviews and seeing the pictures of other people's food makes me sad that I can't go back and eat more of their ridiculously delicious steak. Their chips were juicy (can you even use that word to describe deep fried potatoes) and amazing. The sauce was also good, but in my honest opinion, the steak was best just with basic salt and pepper. Adorable utensils and popcorn cup perfected the meal.

6Vz-J1Ddu0cO_iiBkMzuVQ.text: The very definition of no-frills steakhouse, Flat Iron has a menu the size of a postcard, a singular choice of steak, no other courses, and shared tables.  There is usually an additional steak special.  The only choices of sides are fries and a few salads.Atmosphere is cosy, staff are very friendly.The steaks are quite nice, fresh meat from UK-farms.  The cuts are different from an American steakhouse, ie sirloin, strip, ribeye, etc, less flavorful, but much more tender.Nice meal, good value.

EC14ROHxsygzOrOZNOLoZA.text: Here's the thing, I LOVE STEAK. I'm a big fat steak lover. I love Gaucho, I love Goodman, I love Le Relais de Venise, I love Hawksmoor, I love steak. So the prospect of going to another steak restaurant that came so highly recommended was one I dribbled with excitement at. It doesn't disappoint. They serve a flat steak on an iron slab (hence the name). They recommend to have it medium rare (they're right) and it's £10. Yes suck on that Gaucho - £10. That's what I call good value. They also have a no frills policy. This means you can sit on a table with other guests, they serve red wine in cups,  and they don't serve coffee or dessert. It's all about the steak. They also do a mean aubergine side (wow it's amazing) and chips that make me want to give up the gym, get fat, and become obese forever.

8Ym7jOngInzhuxbBANTM1Q.text: This place was great... most especially for the meat lover. My girlfriend and I popped into this place for an early dinner so luckily for us, there was no wait. The bearnaise sauce is really delicious. It really compliments the steak well.  I had the Wagyu burger with truffle hollandaise.  Their menu wasn't complicated so it was easy on the kitchen and the food came right out. The menu is al la carte so that explains the prices. We would definitely go back the next time we're in town.

X2xfpuc-CV49fFgpGNov9g.text: Not worth the hype, unfortunately.I went on a weekend for an early dinner with friends and only had to wait a short while before we were seated on the ground floor, next to the serving area. We'd had a drink in the basement bar (opened just for us, what luck!) and were able to order food quickly, but unfortunately the service went downhill after that (inattentiveness).The burger was on as the 'special' so a friend and I went 50/50 on a steak and burger to maximise things to try.I'll say this plainly, ask for no salt on your steak. The meat tasted good, but only when I'd been able to get rid of all the sea-salt flakes liberally applied over it. The burger was also heavily salted, though I'm not sure whether in the patty (fried, thick, juicy, good) or the bearnaise sauce topping.Personal preferences on seasoning levels aside, the sides were of generally good quality (the vegetarian in the group went through a few...), with the creamed spinach being a personal highlight. The much vaunted chips, cooked in beef dripping, came out lukewarm initially but were exchanged for fresh, hot ones (once attention was given to us by the staff). Very acceptable for thin-cut fries, punching up there with Honest Burger's rosemary chips, but not quite beating them.For the price, not bad (there are others which do slightly better for slightly less), but definitely too much salt. Solid over all, but not special enough to be worth more than a 10/15 minute wait (which could see you hop in a cab to Sophie's Steakhouse in Covent for their pre-theatre set).

Lm6kzpC9uV9Q7GULlqF77g.text: Lovely place and a great steak! The menu is simple: you can order steak and side dishes,  and that's about it. I had the flat iron steak, which was delicious, and thought the popcorn at the beginning was an amazing idea. The staff was also super lovely and one waitress also brought me salted caramel chocolate mousse for my birthday, which was really tasty. Overall a fun place with good prices, a friendly staff and great steak.

OXqjiTM7vVp1WdEDU3dwXw.text: Best meal we had in London since arriving 6 days ago.  Steaks were SO tender, perfectly cooked and seasoned, side salad and dressing were great, and our steamed broccoli was perfect!   The staff was REALLY nice, too! Laid back, friendly crew!  Thanks for a great meal and experience!!

cBcha56_lMM-yZI_dHNN8Q.text: I was highly disappointed with the service at Flat Iron. First, the servers were not attentive at all. It was late afternoon on a Sunday and the place was not full. We saw the servers busy chatting around the counter not paying much attention to the tables.There were 7 in our group and we paid individually. One of us changed her mind and decided to pay by card after the card machine was brought back to the counter. The server had this 'very displeased' look on her face and acted very annoyed which made everyone in the group feel uncomfortable. She was also not particularly nice when she was taking the dishes from the table. The food was ok, but not amazing. As many others have said the portions are quite small. The price is not bad for the location but I don't think I am not going back again.

BlVabEGgOJT280rzOF_qRQ.text: Not bad for the price I suppose and I do really like the concept.  Our server was great and the steaks were cooked as ordered but under seasoned in my opinion.  One came sliced and one did not which I found strange given that you don't get a steak knife, just a themed mini butcher type knife that is very dull.  Meaning I had to basically tear the rib eye instead of cutting it which bothered me.  Also wasn't really a fan of the chips but the side salad was quite good.  It has potential to be really great and perhaps I got it on a bad day.  I do think it's worth trying despite my experience

tIdbyJ8UXEZ8EWRhfTgZlQ.text: Been to Flat Iron for a a quick beef & beer,Highly recommended!! The atmosphere is unique the music is great and the guys at the place are very kind and welcome.Be sure you pay the place a visit if your in London.

EDZgvd3Buyvc5iNzTQlVVw.text: Very rude and dishonest. My friends and I waited for 45 minutes as the receptionist said, and then the receptionist later said, 'oh! you probs heard me saying 45 minutes. I said 1hr and 45mins.' Such a liar! All three of us heard he said 45 minutes. What's more, he kept on lying to people after us with the time that's an hour less than the exact waiting time. Can't believe they use this trick to keep their customers waiting! Such a waste of time for this dishonest restaurant.

gF0_zzppEpNFDlMuom2ksg.text: This is a small place, but with real hype. Their flat iron steak was excellent. It was so good that I ordered another one. At 10 pounds a flat steak, you can't go wrong. We had a total of 3 orders of flatiron steaks with sides drinks and sauce and it just cost i around 50 pounds. What a deal. Only thing, you need to come here early and put your name and number down because the wait can be long. Up to 2 hours for 2 people from what I experienced. But it's ok, cause there are plenty of pubs around the corner to pass the time. And unless you reserve a group of 6. Don't expect to have your own table. Overall the staff were fast and friendly, the food excellent

VZiostYY-yho4rU9k256vw.text: Literally recommend this place. Got a medium rare steak with peppercorn sauce (OMG SO GOOD!!) and creamed spinach ( must try) and dipping chips (wow, didn't know fries can be that good) WOULD DEF COME HERE AGAIN, so worth the money!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

KRTTbinK64Z_HwPpp-gdJw.text: Service was excellent! We went around 6:30 for dinner and there was already a decent size line for people to put their names down. It went very quickly and the hosts were very nice and friendly. We were given a text and told the wait would be 30-45 minutes. The wait time was right on time and we were seated as soon as we checked back in. Our steaks were cooked perfectly and the peppercorn sauce was delicious! The chips and creamed spinach were so good as well! Overall an excellent value. Love the free salted caramel ice cream!

HNzt5QB80AFIZzgbcoZ3xA.text: Went on a Sunday evening around 8:40 pm. I did not get the name of the host at the front but he had a great personality! Very inviting. He made it not so bad to have to wait 45 minutes. We gave them our contact (Americans - remember to +1 before giving your phone numbers) The system they use is pretty intuitive, you get to see what place in line you are and they message you when it's your turn. You get 10 minutes to get back to the restaurant for your table.The server was prompt, nothing special. The husband and I both ordered the steak medium rare - I added Fred's sauce (hot tomato sauce - has a bit of horseradish). We also had as sides the salad with the blue cheese and the creamed spinach. The steak had cooled off quite a bit by the time it arrived to our table, but the rest of the items were fine in temperature. The creamed spinach was a highlight for us. The spinach is very finely chopped up, making the experience of eating the creamed spinach less stringy!

EcRH0wGonfXo8jGmZyadtg.text: Great for quick steak bite. I came on a Thu afternoon and downstairs was empty but it quickly got filled around lunch time. However there was always seat available at the bar. Medium cooked steak with peppercorn sauce was really juicy. Its not much so better order a side. One of the best I have had in London. The chocolate mousse was good too.

-neZUNhpTE2-mfdIjGsJfg.text: Worth the wait!Definitely a lot of bang for your buck, as the steak is just £10 but is perfectly prepared and cooked. Did not disappoint and lived up to the hype!We ordered three sides, the spinach, salad, and fries, and it was perfect to share. The wine was decent too, and our server was really great and helpful with the selection.Super friendly service, good vibes, and great food!

vg6T5Yf_L7cGilq0iPf6Qg.text: This place was pretty awesome. Our first stop for food in London and I have to say that we had the best waiter in the place! He was so nice and had plenty of recommendations of places that we should visit while here on Holiday. We've gone to a few of those recommended places and they were just as awesome as described! Thank You!!

_GK8kyl9d2qvJNiL7T-UIg.text: Really great steak and great for a lunch or dinner on the cheaper side. Tables are family style and it's crazy busy during dinner hours but worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

HZOiRoKljnvRev7zYp0J6A.text: Good steak and sides. Can't really beat 10£ The line was really long when we were there, averaging 45-1 hour for a table for 2. I'd skip the ice cream desert however. The soft serve was half melted by the time it arrived at our table. Good and friendly staff.

eFh0c8tdM6VoVIdSJLsJOQ.text: This happens to be the spot where I met my husband he was on his way to see his dad.   Love this place always.

IBqIS4t_r23Jf39UjLpRqQ.text: I wouldn't come here for the steaks but the service was amazing and the bartender downstairs had the best drink recommendations. I tried the beaver town gamma ray IPA which is made locally in Tottenham and it was really good. Decent food great atmosphere and amazing service. Food options are limited like you have really one option the flat iron with different sides and they usually have two specials on the wall

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Small probably 8 to 10 ounces skirt steak was good but not filling or amazing would probably have to order two.
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Recommended by the bartender who use to be a sommelier. Pretty damn delicious hopefully I can find this when I get back home.
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. I had four of these while i waited it's that good

-SeCnpN9TDXuV_g77OG9cw.text: Well I'm going to be a little more charitable than my friend Bethany!A friend organised lunch there last Tuesday...I get a text saying where are you, we have a table in 25 minutes...what?  So 5 minutes later I arrived to find my friend and half the Japanese tourists in London queuing outside on the pavement...double what?After about 5 more minutes a chap appeared and said our table was ready and we went upstairs to find rows of tables for say 6 with chairs fixed to the floor...not good if you're tall like me...and the other half of all the Japanese tourists in London...got to be in the guide book!There seemed to be a choice of steak or Wagu NZ steak...we had the steak and at £10 its well worth it...the chips in dripping and horseradish sauce (yummy)...washed down with a Malbec...all excellent...didn't bother with the salt caramel dessertYes we were all a little squashed and yes life stories everywhere but since they were in Japanese who cared...Enjoyable, friendly welcome. good service...but, when we asked for a coffee to round off...we don't do coffee...triple what? Really, not a good moveGo again? yes on balance I will, especially at that price

3QJBdKVxarYDqzjguvZRZA.text: Usually a queue but worth the wait. This is one of the best steaks in London and excellent value for money. The steak is cooked to perfection and is complimented by tasty selection of sides

BkWDypTHY5jd5Pdccdm4hQ.text: We absolutely loved the flat iron steak! So delish! Wished it was a bigger portion! Cooked just the way we like it and the fries, just perfect. Service was great

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

Ej-WZ1maE9aenPfDy76FKw.text: Probably the best and cheapest good steak in London. The sides are also amazing and the dessert is also quite good. The service is always cheerful and good! 100% recommended!

n6yDPydGJFm_iK3cyM0VFw.text: Best 10£ steak in town. Chips are crunchy and tasty. Steak was not the greatest cut of meat but it was cooked properly and seasoned well. The sauteed kale was awesome. Would totally go back.

idNID_kV4V837DQ6P8Mv3g.text: simple menu: £10 steak or burger and 5 sides.   It was tasty, but the portion were way too small. Paid £40 for dinner for two and left hungry

MVb-dNK3A9dB_quXMZjL9A.text: Co-workers brought me here proclaiming Flat Iron was their favorite restaurant, and I must agree that it is definitely stellar. This is where you go to get a juicy, tender, well-cut piece of steak, crisp fries, and fantastic veggie sides like kale with peas and aubergine. We also managed to avoid the crowds by dining here at 10pm (or 22:00), and even got the sweet center table that looks like a party bench. Good times.

crpIpd8-eGwSpLvRmw60VQ.text: There's only one main course on the menu - flat iron steak (but they did have a couple daily specials - a burger and a wagyu steak the night I went).  Perfectly cooked, flavorful, and buttery, and very simply presented.   Other options on the menu include a few different side dishes and sauces.  I opted for the slightly spicy Fred's sauce, which I thought was a great dipping sauce for the beef dripping fries.  The fries were a little pale but overall had great flavor.They have a few wine and beer options, as well as one dessert which I was too full to order.No reservations and there seemed to be a relatively long wait, although the wait was in reality not as long as what the host said.

VaHnl75limljWMdATa1DGw.text: Yes the no reservations thing is a bit old, but in this case I think it's worth it. My most recent visit, I actually arrived in good time, but my date didn't so we had to go on the waiting list for a table. 5 minutes earlier and we would have had a table, but instead we spent half an hour in their funky basement bar. The drinks were well made but it got quite busy. Thankfully it wasn't rammed by the time we had to go upstairs and be seated. So for the uninitiated Flat iron generally only has one main course on the menu - Flat Iron steak at the price of £10, pretty decent price in my opinion, especially when you get to the quality of the steak. Sides and sauces are extra, you've got the usual béarnaise and peppercorn sauces and sides consist of chips, seasonal greens and an aubergine parmesan which you shouldn't pass up. They have specials but I've always gone for the steak, it's that good. Your cutlery comprises of a normal fork and the cutest little cleaver you've ever seen, with your steak served on a little chopping block.Our food came quickly and went down very well, we were offered dessert but didn't take them up on it, and we were quite full from the main meal. Service was good but the restaurant is a little cramped, if you want to be intimate, this isn't really the place to be but good as a date meal, it's good food, won't break the bank and you've got a bar downstairs or a myriad of other options for a drink afterwards. I asked about vegetarian dishes and apparently they do a larger version of the aubergine parm which, as it's the best side on the menu, may not be a bad thing!

ov3fqAoXm2pP3oHg48Kw3Q.text: It's good value for price, i mean the regular steak is only £10 and the taste Itself is good. If you are looking for a place to have quality steak however, hawksmoor seven dials is the place to go to. (But ofcourse, a lot more expensive)

wXfeE-PpG5bAOnpf-9mIMg.text: Great stake place, the flat iron in my experience is really good and works better price vs size that the Rib eye and the burguer, the sides are good .Only big downside is you have really long waiting list .And you get an amaizing free icecream when you leave!

Jkt71qWSXAIjx3M_V5d7fw.text: £10 steak expertly prepared (happy animals, right cut, wet aged and sous vide then finished on grill) with chips cooked in drippings with a glass of Malbec makes for heaven. Also our waiter was well informed and appropriately chatty. The wait was okay since we could decamp to the pub next door! So happy!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. The flat iron steak

5gBs7jgKMsB4EoxjetN79w.text: 10 items or less on the menu. Very small portions of food I have had better burgers, the food was less the average. Im a big person and I had to sit at  a table that looked like a picnic bench, and barely fit on it, . The built in seats were very uncomfortable. Alcohol was limited to beer or wine. Not completely dissatisfied but would never recommend.

1Arv4gnKZKFo5UfJvX8A3A.text: When my husband led us here for lunch I wasn't excited as I'm vegetarian. But this steak place made the best eggplant bake I've ever had along with a delicious green salad. I was pleasantly surprised. The complementary ice cream was also a nice surprise.

GV2PRKaQH3hfcnA974SKTw.text: Friendly service, delicious steak and not too pricey. Only downside is its a bit crammed and you'll likely be sitting right beside a stranger. Don't let that put you off too much tho

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

eeoQ8lUMOAgFromnBQYQgw.text: Great steaks and yummy sides! Good for food at odd times, because at busy times it's impossible to get a table. Great value and a good meal. Except that you have to share tiny seats with people in very close proximity to you!

UfvJve7ZuRaHwTAf3vpEvA.text: Perfect medium rare steak! The beef was juicy tender and flavourful. The bernaisse sauce is the best in my opinion! The cream horradish was a little strong.. Their chips are amazing as well !

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

fQBRcWcfElUuLaFGE7jOGQ.text: Bit of a wait, so be prepared. I witnessed a few groups wait until they were famished to get into line then learn there's a 90 min wait. A lot of shops around the corner to waste time at. Get there early. Had the special: flank. It's my favorite cut so no brainer. Well seasoned and nice sides (chips and broccoli). They're known for creamed spinach but that's too rich for me. Only one dessert option which didn't fancy me (mousse).

op6mANCNUMWhTzdqaTJIHQ.text: Getting a table in Flat Iron is a feat in itself. You either have to be very strategic or just very patient but ultimately it will be worth it. Steak for £10? Hmm. Okay. Decent steak for £10? Unheard of! Till now.   The seating is very cramped and you will become quite familiar with those sat around you but in some ways I like this as it has a very chilled out and unpretentious atmosphere.   Obviously the steak is nice but the sides are actually really nice too. They had an aubergine tomato dish before that was gorgeous! I think you get great value here and as long as it's not over an hour wait it's well worth it as you can go and have a drink elsewhere and they'll tell you when to come back.

G5AKK5lVKDHANPX1MF4ICw.text: Oh I love Flat Iron. I've been twice now and I really try not to go to the same restaurant too many times. The steak is perfect (medium rare) and in my opinion, no extra sauce is needed. The side dishes are good too - chips (amazing), creamed spinach (yummy), aubergine dish (mmmmmm)!! The wine selection is good too!My only criticism is that you have to wait, sometimes for 2 hours, for a table and they don't have a bar you can sit at, so you have to find a nearby bar/pub.

RHMr9WCK2fqOiYCNAi8qyw.text: We were here in July for our honeymoon, and we weren't sure where to go eat.  So where else do you go and search for a great place to eat!  We went to this restaurant because of the rave reviews on Yelp.  We left pretty dissatisfied. First off, just like a previous poster stated, we waited for 1hr45min for our table, just to find out that 80% of the tables are free.  I think the wait is partly because there is only 1 waiter per floor and 1 bartender per floor.  Not sure how many floors there are. It was towards the end of the night, and the waitress had decidedly checked out for the day.  We overheard her and the bartender making plans for after all the customers left, which leads into the waitress' careless attitude for the night.  She didn't cover the house dinner specials at all.  We had to ask her after we had put the order in, and saw the chalk scribble on the blackboard wall, that there were offering specials that night.  Her response was: oh right!...She also forgot to tell us that they had ran out of dessert earlier.  We found out after we had decided to order desserts.  I generally don't like dessert, but decided to order the dessert because I was actually still hungry. (and I generally eat small portions) The steak was cooked very well, but it was a very small portion.  The sides were good as well, but again, I was not yet full.  Lastly, adding to our waitress' careless attitude, she charged an additional steak to our check.  To her credit, she did catch her mistake.  They had to void the previous charge and charged the corrected amount.  Tip to the restaurant:  If you're not playing music, the diners can hear what your wait staff are talking about.  Also, let your diners know ahead of time if you run out of your one and only dessert item.  I did mention that to our waitress as well before we left.  Lastly, maybe hire more wait staff so folks don't wait 1hr45min just to see that the restaurant is basically empty.  It sets a very bad impression from the start.

j8olJHNawtcPW52iRN-LSA.text: This was quite possibly the best meal I've had in a long time followed by the best service I have ever encountered! Between me and my mother we ordered everything on the menu! And loved it! I truly can't thank the staff enough for creating such an amazing atmosphere. My waiter had such an amazing personality and he really made us feel like we were partaking in something special. My trip to London was a complete wash It was quite possibly the most stressful vacation I've ever been on. However for my last night in London to have been lucky enough to dine at Flat Iron was a true saving grace. Thank you flat iron!

D4V64khu7NPA81WKijxxEg.text: I like the concept - cheap good steak and no reservations. What I didn't like is the long waiting line (seriously, 3 hours wait? I can eat and then get hungry and then it would be time for my turn). So, suggest going there around 6pm to guarantee yourself a table. Inside it's nice, cozy and dark - perfect place to catch up with friends as well as go on a date.Also, to note - steak isn't large. It's £10 after all.

i8CqyDhAcDFEmpCGiKdaaQ.text: £10 steak - what's not to love?!The steak is served pre-sliced on a wooden board, and a small butcher knife replaces the regular steak knife (super cute!). So delicious, medium rare, with prominent beef flavor that I love. Tender shoulder cut of beef, which has slightly more bite/fibrous than rib eye. Sauces and sides cost extra. Didn't like creamed spinach but the fries were good. The space is small and dark, with communal wooden tables/stools - a bit cramped, but love it! Verdict: Delicious steak, great value. Quite busy at night with long waits! (went around 9pm)

D_uK8uF-mrdLW9RBsBUemQ.text: Came here for lunch on a Monday & went straight in to find plenty of seats free. I went for the £10 Flat Iron steak & the hubby had the £15 Cornish Bavette special. Both were cooked perfectly although I preferred my leaner choice. We had these with some bernaise & peppercorn sauces, the rightly popular creamed spinach & market greens (which were deliciously buttered kale) as well as the standard chips on the side. The chips were a tad over seasoned for my liking but not too much spoil the rest of the meal. I would come here again for the fact that this was a great value meal, the service was good & the steak hit the spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Flat Iron Steak

MNCScDHVOH1EPKWlW_8bfA.text: What a fun experience! There is only 1 "main" dish £10 for their signature steak. Then you pick the various sides and sauces. My friend and I each ordered a steak, I had horseradish sauce and she had the Fred's sauce. We had salad, chips, with a bottle of bubbly for lunch.There were some Key wins:1 pm on saturday : NO WAIT! Win!Melt in your mouth steak: Win!Simple menus and fast service: YAY! win!I loved this more than the Le Relais de l'Entrecôte in Paris - which serves steak with green sauce and fries. GOOD VALUE GOOD STEAK!

a2J4mgyLQjoBCL9Huq0lTQ.text: Steak was delicious but comes in small quantity, more like appetiser than main dish. I sat upstairs and shared table, noticed this with busy restaurants and super noisy. The chips was over cooked but the creamy spinach taste beautiful.

Ew9Dk14JMasNVtk9cKXb-g.text: Great spot!Be prepared to wait during popular times - we got there on a Friday night around 6:45pm and were put on the digital queue. Super convenient system. You give them your contact information and you can look up your place in line at any time. There are tons of places to grab a drink nearby while you wait. Once your table is ready, you have 10 minutes to claim it, so don't wander too far!There's popcorn to share at the table. Of course, we ordered the steak (which was great) and a few sides (which were less great). Nonetheless, for the price and quality it was a great meal. Good ambiance and service was very friendly. Did I mention they play throwback music?

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. We ordered sides too - cabbage, chips & creamed spinach

GQlDEEqEEjqHkPxGbk_tyA.text: This place was excellent. The steak was great, however, I returned the first offering because it was over cooked. The staff was very apologetic and expeditiously returned the best skirt steak that I've ever eaten. This place is a "must have" while you're in the UK.

fF8SIbZRJ0IRG-DOykchnQ.text: First time to London, first time to Flat Iron.  Starting with getting a table, dining solo, was told 30-35 minutes, actually got sat around 45-50 minutes.  Sat at the bar with other solos, service was polite, prompt and attentive.  Ordered medium rare steak, cream spinach, salad & Beavertown Gamma Ray IPA or is it "APA"?  Order came out quick, steak was thin, tender & perfectly cooked, creamed spinach was delicious, salad & vinaigrette was good, the beer was great.  All priced very well & laidback  atmosphere reminded me of a place in Austin.  No reservations on the website, and  45 -50 minute wait on a Monday at 7pm was the reasons for only 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

0XpolCpedJrhxOmWVBJRRg.text: This place is SO GOOD! The staff is super friendly and the food is amazing. We got a flat iron and rib eye, dipping chips (best ever) and some broccoli plus side salads. Everything was delicious. I'm still not over how good the rib eye was. The popcorn they give you to start was a nice touch and the drinks are well made. I'd highly recommend.

nrVs1QRw1eybGGyDSnEDmg.text: Loved the spot! Fantastic affordable flat iron steak! The restaurant is cozy and intimate and the popcorn appetizer is a nice touch. There is usually a long wait because there are no places you can get a steak this good for such a reasonable cost. Definitely order it prepared medium rare - it is DELICIOUS! It pairs great with the peppercorn sauce. The creamed spinach is a yummy side option, as is broccoli (which was a special when we went). The food came out fast, but it was well worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. YUM

7eO7NImpo9p-lsxYj9DIAQ.text: Ok guys...here is how it is. We were in London and I looked at the reviews for this place and we decided to give it a try. When we got there they only had tables available downstairs so we passed...walked around for awhile and decided to go back. They put us in a small room in the back...Ok ...our waiter...excellent !The food...best we had in Europe! Yes really! Order everything and eat it all! You might want to order an extra steak for three people...at 10 pounds it is sooo worth it!5 stars!If you don't know what a flatiron steak is...I didn't either...I always go for a rib eye or fillet...when we got back to the States I looked it up...it's a shoulder blade steak with the tendon removed...as it says on the internet...more flavor and probably the best and under rated cut of meat you can get!Went to the local store...brought one home and grilled it...great!Thanks Flat Iron!!!

cz_BCZZLqlBNZIZhHTP7Sw.text: I was really forward to going to flat iron. The menu was simple and basic which makes things easy. The steak was ok. The place is really small and seating is tight.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

HNDYVPGKasEUOAfVtClk4g.text: Sometimes, the picture is more satisfying than the food. As someone that was immensely excited to take a bite into the Instagrammable cut of steak, my overall experience was highly disappointed. Upon arrival at the place, my expectations of this fine establishment, were definitely well met. The beautiful interior and welcoming atmosphere, were just what  I had imagined. Their eye for detail in the cutlery for your steak made the experience so much better. It was however upon opening the menu, that my experience began to descend. As usual, I ordered the standard flat iron steak with a side of crips. Now, being brutally honest as I like to be. My expectations of course were of a beautiful piece of large steak to be perfectly seasoned right in front of me. I however, instead received, what could be the baby of my dream like steak. The truth is the unsalted piece of steak in front of me was definitely not worth the 10 pounds I paid.  The crips  on the other hand were perfectly crispy with a touch of fluffiness inside them.  As for the so called side salad, well it might have been easier to go Tesco and drown a couple of leaves in olive oil, because that is just what I got. Now while, my experience was not as expected. I would say in this case, you pay for the atmosphere and the curiosity to try a steak that is often seen on your feed. In total the meal came out to nearly 14 pounds and two hungry people.

PlKqR_5uSD2d9jUg-NhQwA.text: Last night in London and we decided to go to Flat Iron.an hour and a half wait but we were texted with a 10 minutes to go alert. Amazing staff and the best steak I ever had! Wonderful finale to the trip!! Do yourselves a favour and come here no matter how long the wait!!

euJ3D4qqJlnYyM9Ed1OyYQ.text: We've been disappointed with some of the food we've had in London and Flat Iron is not one of those places.  The Eggplant is a must!  The steak was cooked perfectly to a medium rare. I also heard you can still get your burgers done that way here too!Dessert was out of this world amazing! A must eat when you are in London!  I will be back!

1DYglyYyJMqFhv4jNaUoTA.text: Seats are so hot and usually unavailable in dinner time. Free iced water and popcorn is served and waiters were very enthusiastic & helpful. The price is reasonable and they give burgers full weigh so that my friend and I couldn't eat desserts after the meal.第一次去吃的时候正值晚餐，没有座位了。第二次挑了午餐开门时间，终于落座了，赠送了免费的冰水和牛油香味的爆米花。服务员态度非常随和且平易近人，我和朋友都点了 Speical Offer 的牛肉汉堡，外加薯条和酱料，分量超级足，价格也不是很贵，性价比非常高。

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

HoLTgi5IvuZgN-QAqb8Ehg.text: I would recommend their peppercorn sauce! Very delicious! The steak itself it's alright.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

O4ZfP8oHhj2j24iSx_STiw.text: My friend gave me a rave recommendation to this place and I was excited to try it, during my first night in London no less. We lined up and put our names down for a table, and were told the wait would be 45 min. That was fine, because we just went to a bar and waited for their text to let us know our table was ready. Be prepared for the wait. I ordered the steak with peppercorn sauce which came with a side salad. We also ordered fries to share. The good: steak was pretty on point and at such a great and affordable price (~£10). I ordered mine medium rare and it was cooked perfectly. The peppercorn sauce was delicious. It reminded me of turkey gravy. You cannot lose with steak and turkey gravy. The side salad was pleasant- a nice little healthy touch to the otherwise caloric meal. The fries were good, nothing to really rave about. I thought the mini butcher knife (as the steak cutting knife) was a cute touch and I got a nice kick out of using it.Now the ugly: I began to realize the service they were giving us was not the same service given to the patrons sitting around us. Point #1: we were not given the free popcorn once we sat down, but the 2 guys who were seated right next to us (same table) received the cup of popcorn upon sitting without even asking. No, they were not regulars because Point #2: the waitress (same as ours) asked them if it was their first time there. They said yes, so she proceeded to explain in detail the daily specials. Er, 20 minutes earlier she literally just pointed at the chalkboard and told us "those are the specials over there on the board." I didn't even know where the heck she was pointing at, and had to identify it on the wall myself after she left. Where was my detailed explanation, lady?! Point #3 which could really have been forgivable had point #1 & 2 not occurred, but she tried to take our plates away when it was obvious we still had fries left and still eating. The 2 girls next to us were chatting away with their glasses of water for 30 minutes (not exaggerating) without ANYONE attempting to shoo them off. I mean I was even holding a fry in my hand as she was asking if we were done.I don't know why our level of service was different from the others and I don't want to make any assumptions. I can only hope that someone there reads this and are more conscious of the seemingly small things. I'm giving this place 4 stars because the food was actually good and very reasonably priced.

oF93-8dpLsZWXDtfb0Fcag.text: Damn good steak for a damn good price. Honestly, for about £20-25 you can have a nice steak, some sides, and a beer. Can't really beat that in London. If you want to go during the weekend then make sure to call ahead and make a reservation because it gets super busy.

Uw_-M6mOmAmqLcGGR2vzcA.text: Go here! Hopefully you get to meet darragh! Do what he says :) thanks for all you fantastic suggestions (including the blues bar)

-6bBB3eaUKW9YHaGBZsOdw.text: Went on a weekday afternoon, the place wasn't too busy. We ordered the flat iron and rib eye. The flat iron arrive cold and chewy, as if it was leftovers from a previous grilling session. Not sure why they can't make hot steaks. The female blonde server also gave me a ton of attitude. The sides were great, the aubergine was delicious. But overall a bit disappointing considering we only had a few days in London.

BP9Ujyo81fDIDn_r9HxjYA.text: DELICIOUS. 10/10 recommend you visit here if you are a hard-to-please eater. The focal point of their menu is their steak, which is only £11, and well worth the price. Besides their steak, the menu is also comprised of drinks, sides, and one or two other dishes. Get the steak- it's cooked perfectly and comes with a generously sized vinaigrette salad. Overall, the entire experience was amazing- great service, great ambience, great food, great drinks, and PLUS free ice cream at the end of your meal!

PPgO5mB1XBZCyX2q_ero0Q.text: Meh. I gave 3 stars because the meat and price is good. And That's where the good ends. If you like to be packed like sardines, sharing you table with strangers, more than limited menu, greasy fries, "pink lemonade" that taste like perfume then this is your place.

gkM1TrWp8mwm3IIoSgIYuA.text: Amazing service although it was a late Saturday night. We sat at the only 4 seats table close to the toilets door but it was ok. I chose the special of the day which was the wagyu burger with an hollandaise truffle sauce. Oh boy! It was SO YUMMY!! It is surely entering in my list of top 5 burgers I love the most! Our waitress was great and very friendly. She explained us about these special and that the burger I had might not be available next time I visit the restaurant  (sad face) They do have other locations and they would announce on Facebook where to find these specials. I also had the Fred's sauce which was a spicy tomato dip that was great too with my fries.The unique dessert available is a chocolate mousse and by mousse it is more like a chocolate Whipped cream with salt. It was good and although small in size, it was very filling.Overall, I had a great time and the meal awesome. What else would you ask for in London? ?

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Chocolate mousse
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Excellent Waguy burger
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Fred's sauce spicy tomato

JpOsrdiEz8Q5dW35jueMXg.text: Quite good food, but the grill had gone out apparently. No one was being seated after us, but still our dinners came out eventually. Not sure our steaks were cooked as usual, not as crispy on the outside as seen in photos. So, this review may not be for the usual meal. Sides & sauce v good, dessert heavenly. Service a bit missing in action.

V0TK8rTSWRjMx2DLE4umiQ.text: £10 for a steak just off Carnaby Street. ... yes it does exist and it's actually tasty. Served with awesome peppercorn sauce and chips cooked in dripping.. .. what's not to like.Small little place with shared tables delivering a great vibe. If you have to wait to be seated then you can grab a drink in the bar down stairs.Enjoy

jIJFuaj3aSF4bJT9n13AYg.text: I've been wanting to come here for a while and finally got around to it, and I'm so happy I did!I came here with my partner who is a big lover of steaks. Upon arrival our names were promptly taken and went downstairs to wait. Be advised that it can be a struggle finding a seat downstairs as it's just so busy! We stood for most of the wait which was fine since we'd just been sitting for 2 hours at a show but you'll have to be ruthless if you're tired from a full day's walking. The cocktails at the bar were really nice though so it's not an unpleasant wait!Thankfully we got called early and were seated upstairs. Note if you're under probably 5 people you will be sharing a table with others. This wasn't a big deal until later when a second group was seated at our table who were mahoosively muscular. Good thing we were about to leave because I would have hated sitting with them for the whole meal! Flat Iron is definitely not for those who value their personal space.They put popcorn down at your table which tastes awesome and I wish we could have had more. The service was quite slow. We were visibly ready to order fairly quickly but had to wait quite a while for anyone to come to us.
