The server was very nice though and I can understand it being a bit disjointed considering how busy the restaurant is. And we didn't have to wait too long for our drinks and food once we ordered so it wasn't too bad.The steaks were cooked really well. Of course as we know, the steak is only a tenner each, and you get a nice portion. The sauces we tried were yum. The creamed spinach was lovely, and the chips were decent. They didn't have normal Sprite but they had rose lemonade, and this was a huge novel highlight to my meal. If you don't like floral things you'll be put off, but please, it's so strange and beautiful and pleasing to drink this stuff!Something that bothered me a bit was that they had small bowls of salt and pepper that you had to put your fingers in to pick up and sprinkle on your food. I like this idea and the sort of tactile experience, but it's not really the most hygienic, especially when it's being shared with people you don't know.Overall there were a couple things I had issues with but I would definitely bring a small group here again, probably not just one or two other people though. BIG parties!

y613AN-2YCqlUM1b3TaRyg.text: So everyone are raving about Flat Iron and decided to go and find out myself.We arrive mid afternoon so the place was half empty. It also smelt funny... not the aroma of the steak or food in general, just stale smell like a market! The review recommended the Aubergine dish which my partner & I both loved it. The chips was ok. Our salads welted as it seems it's been swimming in its dressing all day. One thing my partner pointed out was that he doesn't understand why there are a bunch of sea salt sprinkled on the steak. He understands that if it's to season the steak whilst cooking it but it looks more like a garnish. He found the steak too salty and hence the steak is ruined. The chef should really give this option to the customers, to top up with more sea salt or not.Overall it didn't live up to the hype.  We are a bit of a "steak" snob, regardless of the price, so the quality of the steak in Flat Iron is average. But for £10, I can't really complain too much. I think I'd rather pay a little more for a good flavoured steak.

m2_3_T5MquzLjMyFekazUg.text: Great value £10 steaks; a lesser known cut translates to great value. It's the only entree except for their daily special, so it's obviously cooked excellently. The knife is a miniature butchers knife, and slices well.Creamed spinach side dish and salted caramel foam in cup dessert is outstanding.

B0hlKCDX7wyRfErrubvGWQ.text: EPIC STEAK JOINT.At £10 a pop, you can't go wrong at Flat Iron. I asked for my steak to be done Blue, and it came pretty blue. The Bernaise sauce was fairly epic, highly recommended.Only downside is that this popular spot gets super noisy - don't go there on a date you won't hear what the person is saying across the table from you.The cocktail bar downstairs is great fun - treat yourself to a hot doughnut whilst you're down there.Can't recommend this place enough, trendy, affordable, fun - don't miss it  !

lsm6QK6OGRvNdjExlX5QLw.text: The Steak and sides were damn good and the price was average but the size of the steak was small (around 200g) so I had to order a second one. I can definitely recommend this place.

OfaIlUvNoVB84RsObKjtfQ.text: OK, so the first time I tried to come here, we were looking at an hour queue.. on a Monday. I made a .gif face that threw some grade A shade, but knew deep down inside that I would come back. Cut to today, no wait, perhaps post-holiday shoppers, and two steaks, chips, sodas for the total price of one of my favorite steaks from Hawksmoor. I made a .gif face that had all the rainbows coming out of my eyes. Love the music, love the simplicity, I will be pumping myself up to endure more queues (or finding the off-peak times) in the future. If you're central and want a *good* steak on the cheap, you'd be pressed to find something better. Little loud if you're next to a chatty cathy, but eh, deal with it.

FNO_v3L4TAWM6jmVxtdisA.text: Flat Iron is very much in the current vein of places that offer a limited menu. Thankfully enough, what is on offer is of such undoubted quality, that it is of little mind.In steak terms, I'm in the ever-dwindling take-it-or-leave-it camp. This is as much due to an Irish heritage that considers 'boiled' a food group, which means I have been subjected to some pieces of meat that have received the care and attention of a Ted Bundy-esque chef.The steaks are great - really well priced, fantastically-cooked and with sides that are of perfect sharing size. The fries and blue cheese salad are excellent.The staff are on hand to assist without fuss, and some great drinks on offer as well.Get involved fam.

3dLek2nIC0zC2fLOadoakw.text: So deserving of 5 Stars. The food, the price, the atmosphere - it's all consistently outstanding. Please go and try Flat Iron!

fWg-dCRqBzWQJq4f0gN8hQ.text: If the Wagyu is on the menu you're in for a treat. Everyone in my party doubled up with a Wagyu and house flat iron. Both were great with the Wagyu a clear winner for flavor and texture. If you aren't in the mood for steak this is not the place for you. The menu is rather limited to, well, steak. The beer menu was ok but everything was in a bottle.

B0LY0IHBUCGFD-kEqBUO7g.text: Great, inexpensive steak. No pretense, just good food: went at 1:30pm on a Friday 1 no problem getting a table and good service

Y7Mgz3aVW7WMrBiC2G-TVA.text: £10 steak in heart of soho?! Wow. Hard to believe but they deliver on every level. You can't reserve but it's well worth the wait. Quick service, incredible steak. We also had the spinach and fries, as well as the chocolate caramel  dessert. We accompanied it with a nice 500ml of red wine. Bill came to £50ish. Bargain i would say! Will definitely be going here again.

Y8TiiE2OoaloFzGtUJverQ.text: Absolutely made my evening. The medium rare flat iron steak was just as i liked it - juicy, soft and delicious, the meat carefully aged so that it almost melts in in your mouth.The sides were delightful, chose aubergines and creamy spinach to compliment the beef, but to tell you the truth they could have been a meal in themselves - yes they were that good. Glass of wine, beef and 2 sides came to £27 per person with service, which was totally worth it.

DaYFyZM8e7nGzloUCu5gdw.text: Amazing place! Steak lovers are going to love. Just go for the flat iron steak with dripping cooked chips, and you will be fully satisfied. However, service could be more attentive.

P3lbNTHwL3bd4r4IlGzrfA.text: Good value and fun environment. Shared tables mean you meet lots of people. Steak isn't amazing quality but it's not pricey and fast.

Mcy_KDlUhK5DDU_eEEKrIg.text: Flat Iron currently seems to be on the radar as one of the trendy spots in Soho. As yet another no reservation place, expect at least about an hours wait. But whats great is the little bar in the lower ground floor where you can wait comfortably till your table is ready for you. They do only one thing- steak and that's all there is to it. Take it or leave. Vegetarians- don't even bother.How it works is- you choose your steak which is either the Flat iron or the Special. Then choose your sauce and sides. I got the peppermcorn and chips with my flat iron. Which was good- but nothing to write home about. My friend got the bernaise sause and the asparagus, which was probably the better call. The portions of the sauce are pretty generous so he dipped the asparagus in the bernaise which was yum! Tbh the food was good, but I have to admit given all the hype I was slightly underwhelmed.What I will rave about is the service. It was phenomenal. Everyone we interacted with was delightful. Which is great, because understandably at busy restaurants the service tends to slip. Right from the maitre d to the bartender to the waiter - everyone one was delightful, pleasant and really helpful. Price wise I was pretty impressed 20 pounds for a full meal with wine.The ambiance was pretty cool as well, with lots of fittings salvaged from an old printing press.Its really good place, definitely got that trendy Soho vibe, not overly expensive, but like I said, I wasn't entirely blown away by the food.

D__sdGv1DTttpepMnzBG7A.text: Had the chocolate mousse since then and it lives up to the hype: salt crystals with caramel and chocolate deliciousness: kill me now!

OTNzPyAG3zKIbW1xfJ4XYg.text: Simply love this place :)The meat is really good, not choice but I really suggest you to try it!

9alENZKcNXYKH3lDL7kFGg.text: Oh so good. The steak is cooked perfectly and sprinkled with coarse salt. You order your own sides and the steak comes with an amazing little salad that is all the steak really needs in my opinion. I actually love how this place has only one option when it comes to the protein (unless there is also a special). Also love how they made it affordable so everyone gets to try. Now the four instead of five stars is for the seating. I love the communal table thing but the stools are painful and made it hard to eat dinner with a baby (although waitresses were so friendly and sweet with the little one). Definitely wish there was an option I could go to in the US as a regular but will have to keep dreaming about this steak until I visit London again.

Aqaneqm_ZW2XnobXS4c7uA.text: A tenner for a gorgeous steak in Soho?! Absolute bargain! Loved the meaty popcorn, more sides to choose from please.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

ZDjh0nCbBeEuJIYNYy0_kg.text: Went to Flat iron twice and enjoyed both times. The menu is the definition of simplicity. You can get a steak and that's it. There are some optional sides and sauces, but if you don't like steak - stay out. When I was there they had 2 additional specials, another type of steak and a burger. Not surprisingly - I opted for steak. The steaks are served on an iron slab sitting in a wooden tray. Surprisingly on both times, the iron slab was not hot, which was a let down. In addition, the steaks themselves were relatively cool when served. This indicates pre cooking, which is a let down.The steaks were good and tender and if they were only hot - would qualify as top steaks.The fries were good, although overly salted. The sauces were delicious and added to the experience.All in all, a good solid steak place that would really improve if they made the steaks fresh.

rhif5Cgi6Rjkujapzhn6dA.text: This place does the best meat, great drinks and very good service. I would surely revisit Flat Iron

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Pork belly

vLrAaJhpjELJHywHckXmtg.text: Great value for money, perfect for a student or a non student who has just moved over from Australia where the AUD is taking a pummelling against the GBP (aka me). Their menu is awfully simple (in the best possible way) and they do one thing and do it well.

dURdPIWzBm_CVOoEtjTUYA.text: Overall it was a great experience. The steak doesn't cost much and it is delicious, the menu is very easy to choose from in terms of sides and sauces - couple choices for each. They also give you free popcorn as you wait for your food - always a nice gesture. The cutlery is very cute, you get a fork and chopping knife, the decor is urban-industrial with wooden tables and exposed light bulbs. My only negative is that they serve wine in normal tumbler glasses on which I am not a fan personally.

u56yF_meoARueWi0DrP79Q.text: Three words - steak, custard donuts.  Two things that Flat Iron does very, very well. Looking to woo a lad/put him into a meaty food coma? Look no further. Okay, so that was a little sexist...myself and my lady pals have enjoyed a couple of meals here too. I'm not even much of a fan of steak, yet they won me over hands down. The staff are really clued up on what's on the menu, for first timers they're more than happy to listen to what you do & don't normally enjoy meat wise and give you a recommendation - they've never steered me wrong yet.   Each steak is cooked to order, so even if you like it wriggling off the plate or more well done, they're happy to accommodate. There's a lovely little bar downstairs too, so if you are on a hot date & fancy turning it up a notch over cocktails & their delicious custard donuts in a dark corner then this is your place.

uld3FlSJcYEpRNJp2_V4fQ.text: We first came upon this place after a long day of shopping on Oxford street, but the long wait forced us to come back on another day. We decided to come back on the last day of our family vacation and it was absolutely worth the hype. They were serving their wagyu steak special that day which we all ordered. First of all, the ambience for the place was really cozy, and we didn't mind being seated next to other people at all. The service was fantastic, with the server being extremely friendly and peppy. The steaks came out perfectly cooked at medium rare to all of our liking and was melt in your mouth tender. The portions were just right for the pricing at £18 (if I'm remembering correctly) and everybody left satisfied. By far, during my entire trip through Europe, this restaurant stood out the most out of every restaurant, whether it was in Italy or France. If we ever come back to London we'll definitely be making a stop here again!

pui9SdWh7Yc1ozKtrA7IIw.text: As previous people noted there is a long wait for this restaurant but well worth it. For a Saturday night my bf and I had a 2hr wait which wasn't terrible since it gave us an opportunity to stop in for a drink and appetizer next door.  Everything was delicious at Flat Iron and the price was stellar. You get a good size steak and small salad for £10 which you really can't beat. Definitely recommend for a easy casual dinner place while in London.

Aow_uImETDLI1yFjAoN6XQ.text: They do one thing, but do it very well. Food was great and on time, staff was friendly. Even my dad (the world's toughest critic) was impressed!

FMG4DJJUqoZsNXZIvSuNjg.text: Really delicious steak (cooked properly, med rare), the side dishes are tasty. Price tag on the door says £10 which is super reasonable for Central London, but portion size is really small, just be ready for that. Also line is long to get in so I recommend going at 5:30, put your name on the list, go for a drink depending on your wait time then come back.

zdgxyiD2fMKyzd0imR7ufw.text: My wife found this on Yelp and I have to say its a great little place - especially if you are a meat lover. The menu is simple - very very simple. Pick your steak, sauce and sides and thats about it.My wife and I, we decided to try the Wagyu and the regular beef. We both ended up liking the regular steak more - so we decided to order another one (total: 3 orders of steak for 2). The sides were average comparing to others but we came here for the main dish and not the sides.I strongly recommend going early to get a seat. We actually got there a little bit before the main dinner rush and we had to wait about 30-40 minutes. By the time we actually sat down for dinner, the wait time was around 1 hour and 30 minutes for all the people coming in.The service was friendly and turned out one of the servers "Elsa" was from Santander, Spain - where I stayed for the summer as an exchange student. Small city in northern Spain. Go Santander!Anyways - back to topic. I would recommend people to check out this place. Just remember, you will have to wait if you decide to go during peak times.

gna0Gv4XOJ9y44XxkDSJKA.text: Fresh meet.. great spices and cook.. i enjoined every bit in this place.. every busy place so avoid rush times so I don't wait..

w4kU831_sU9HmOQHIzhKGg.text: Just two items on the menu?! A special and the flat iron?! How will I cope?! Having lived on this street and having seen the change from bar central to foodie paradise makes me regret I moved away. Flat iron is a place that is reminiscent of an amazing Hawker Centre stall in Singapore. It has queues for at least an hour at any point in the day and it only serves one or two things that it does extremely well. Usually a £10 Flat Iron steak which is great value because it's from the shoulder and thus a little bit tougher than what you'd get from a Fillet Mignon or Sirloin cut. But Flat Iron seems to do it perfectly well and you'd never know the difference. The night I was there, the special was an Onglet grilled medium rare. With 4 in our party, you can essentially order everything (That's what we did -- "Waiter, we want everything on the menu tonight!") since the menu is quite small - but don't take that as a bad thing. Everything is amazing. We even had every single sauce on the menu, which made it a bit of a treat. The best sides I'd suggest are the Roast Aubergine and the Goat's Cheese Salad. The cream spinach isn't the best I've had, and it's not served very warm. The fries are good, but I've also had better. All in all, even though we did have everything on the menu and with one round of drinks, the total per head came to £25, service included! That's really NOT a lot for as much food and fun as we've had. Be prepared to wait though, as I don't see this place ever succumbing to unpopularity. 4*s and DEFINITELY coming back again.

vS1B9QQ_DHRPAtXs2DO2Og.text: Affordable, delicious, responsible, wonderful food.I am hesitant to disclose more because I don't want you to get there before me!  We were lucky that we arrived just in time so didn't have to wait long for a table, and my dining companions have not stopped raving about the steak place I took them to.  It's simple, well-cooked and presented steak that I would return to, as often as I can!

2JDQIMkDEUBdxNzJA6FuFA.text: So a place that does excellent steak dinner, with good beer? Sign me up!! Ok so they have a very focused menu, but when the food is this good who cares?

5BXfJLHH9hs0FLvdnECZ2Q.text: I absolutely LOVE Flat Iron and am sad that I didn't discover it earlier! The place itself is a bit small and I have waited for over 2 hours for a table- on a Tuesday night! But since we did wait that long, that should say enough about how good this place is and how worth the wait is. However, the wait isn't always that long so don't let that detour you.  The actual steak itself is brilliant at it's standard of medium rare. Plus, it's relatively cheap at 10 pounds a steak! And although the steaks aren't the biggest in portion sizes, one steak is able to fill me up. The chips are so bloody good as well. I think it's because of the salt that they have. Definitely put salt on the chips as it just adds to the goodness of them!Overall I can't say enough good things about this place. I think I just might go ahead and say that this place quite possibly is my favourite restaurant of all time!

ebaexniPT_lQ1AjMO4XdNA.text: I really enjoyed my evening at Flat Iron, a good steak, friendly service at an affordable price. At the end of the day, the steak was nowhere near the prime quality of Goodman but that is to be expected for the price you are paying. But I highly recommend this place if you are a steak lover and go for the daily special as you would be surprised how good it can be. Try to avoid going in at peak times on weekends as the wait can be anything up to an hour (it has a no booking policy).

e-NCzD3roFaIXUvISAa7IA.text: After spending a long day work craving a steak I did a quick google of places near by that could potentially satisfy my hunger for beef.  Flat Iron 4 mins walk away. Sorted! Situated on Beak Street in soho this place is a cosy corner a few streets away from the hustle and bustle of Piccadilly  Circus. Their website is simple... a picture of their speciality 'Flat Iron Streak' and an option to join the mailing list. What you see is what you get.The restaurant is small with shared tables as it was originally a pop up restaurant but has stuck around due to its success. The menu is small which means you get served quick and the food is good. We had the Flat Iron steak, Sophie's salad (candied pines nuts were delish) and the dripping cooked chips. The meal was gorgeous and I really liked the relaxed intimate vibe in the place. This is not the best place for a vegetarian as salad is your only option. You can't make reservations so get there early or be prepared to wait.

J5BMADxCSe3L4VnTeojgFQ.text: Before you order here you're given popcorn made with beef drippings - this is singularly the greatest pre-meal snack ever!What else can I mention about this place other than the Wagyu steak. The steak will literally slice like a hot knife through butter and rally does melt in the mouth, this is one of the finest steak I have had in London.Also there has to be an honourable mention for the creamed spinach.

GrrLKP0Vo_TuhPSMUwmlUA.text: This steak was brilliant, for only £10. Good staff and service as well. The selection of beer weren't to wide which was a shame. However The wine selection was excellent.

U7Ha2b2zSG4dzUZJMlvKEA.text: Super busy steak restaurant, I went there yesterday with 3 friends at 19:30 and waited about 80 mins to finally seated on table. The ribeye steak I ordered was simple but very juicy and delicious, so I guess it's worth the wait.

yoyJ2nS5cpmk620iTtJ5xA.text: Great affordable steakhouse in the heart of the Covent Garden shopping district.   Tasty steak, great side dishes, and free scoop of ice cream to take away.   Must try.

Jovy1epB4BSEulj8Gktlsg.text: I heard about Flat Iron and their famous 10 pounds Steak many times, my friends I finally gave it a try after some shopping in Soho as we passed by this location and the queue.They don't take reservations, same as many causal restaurants in London. Be aware of some wait time to eat around London town in Zone 1 (city center) if you are just visiting and not familiar with the local food scene. The restaurant has two levels, it's not small but definitely crowded. Tables are quite close to one another, they play hit songs in the background with a causal and friendly hipster vibe. That's how I would describe it.  The menu is very simple. The One & Only main item is The iron steak. You might choose  sides and sauce. It comes with a side salad. We liked the fries, creamy spinach, and the horseradish and also peppercorn sauce to accompany the steak. Oh, and not to mention, the meal comes with a cup of warm buttery popcorn .I am also a sucker on presentation of the food. The little cleaver is a cute touch ! You can purchase it as you wish as well For the quality and the price, you really cannot go wrong here! I would say my experience matched up with the hype!*** If you are a foodie like me, follow my IG at     @running_muffin      for more recommendation around the world !! :) ***

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Girls - Forget about your salad tonight, Chop Chop it's steak Night, just Eat ! ??? IG: @running_muffin

_zjswe9I-UcPuagqHYYeWg.text: Came to Flat Iron after reading reviews that it's a must go when visiting London which after dining here I think is a major exaggeration. Service: Expect the place to be packed on a Saturday afternoon, waited about 45 mins. They asked for your phone number to text you when your table is ready but for some reason we never received a text so we had to keep stopping back to check with the hostess. Staff was pretty nice and the waiter explained the menu well for first timers. Food: I must say I was a little disappointed in the steak, but then again for £10 I guess you can't expect top notch steak. I do get that the cut of steak used isn't the absolute best, but I thought they would make up for that with the flavor but it was very lackluster for me at least. But Flat Iron's saving grace was their side dishes. I found the creamed spinach and eggplant dishes really good and my favorite part of the meal (which bumped them up a star). The drinks weren't bad either but nothing memorable. Overall, although I thought the simplistic menu and mini butcher knife utensils are cool, I don't think I would come back here. It's one of those places that you go at least once just to say you've eaten there.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Complementary popcorn
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Menu January 2018
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Passion fruit fizz soft drink

DlmocKCF0kiv4Cb3QKQjhg.text: Fun & casual spot!We did have to wait for about 45 minutes, but we were able to give the host our number and walk across the street to grab a quick drink at an Irish pub before our table was ready.The menu is simple with one main entree to choose from - steak! They do have various sides to choose from as well, which were delicious. We ordered two steaks, a side of cabbage, french fries, and a salad to share. My favorite part of the meal was all of the dipping sauces to choose from for the steak (I'm a sauce girl). I went with the peppercorn sauce and it was flavorful and creamy, and even paired well with my french fries.I recommend this place for a casual & inexpensive dinner and hope to be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. My steak & yummy peppercorn sauce

QwzfqW4diFuRInRTzmSuIA.text: We went here twice during our stay in London because the food is terrific and is super reasonably priced. We ordered the flat iron skirt steak and the special ribeye steak. For sides we got the creamed spinach, chips (French fries), and eggplant. Both cuts of meat were perfectly cooked at medium rare. I enjoyed the creamed spinach and fries. Also the peppercorn sauce was amazing on the side. The second time I ordered the dessert...it was too sweet for me to finish.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Side of greens
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Spinach, eggplant and chips (French fries)
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

1C30APQx9KUkw_nZWOivuQ.text: Super!!!! Cost performance is number one amid all the the London stake houses. Taste wise of course yummy not so olily nor unhealthy.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

j--rUOef9YDlorxCQhDK9Q.text: As I said in other replies, I really like London, I also like restaurants and the places in this beautiful town. I visited this restaurant some time ago, but I was very pleased with this place because I ate very good food, had a very friendly waitress and stayed in a very pleasant atmosphere. I ordered the flat iron and it was simple, magnificent and very tasty. For dessert, we ordered the one dessert, on the menu - a mousse with salted caramel sauce and it was delicious. I visited this restaurant with my good friends and it was interesting to taste different food from this restaurant. I also enjoyed the service and the price because everything was extremely affordable for me and my friends, so anyone who wants to taste something good can visit this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

6oEgmOHwgn1qPKPPiLVd1A.text: Loved it! This place is dedicated to perfect each item on its small menu so whatever you choose will be great.It is fairly priced so you can expect to pay around 25£ per person for a steak, salad, add-on dressing and a beer.The setting is nice, the location is small and the quality/price ratio make this place a popular hot spot. At lunchtime, it can take 40 to 70 minutes before you get seated. So, don't arrive at the restaurant very hungry as you will have to wait for a while before the first juicy bite of meat makes it's way to your tastebuds.At the door, I provided my international phone# to be notified when a table would become available. In the meantime I went shopping to the nearby stores on Oxford Rd.Enjoy!

8oRrhL9ALdSR0v4RMtTf7g.text: Everything about this place is POPPIN!Peppercorn sauce; POPPIN!Free pop corn; POPPIN!Shoulder cut; POPPIN!drippin chips; POPPIN!salad; POPPIN!I forgot what we had to drink, I'm sure that was poppin tooSN) I like how they call you when your table is ready

000EipHvoQWywg5Hg0-Pjg.text: Just a perfect steak for £10. Menu is beautifully simple and executed well. There is fun music playing, a cool (crowded) city atmosphere, and very nice service. I sat at the bar as 1 and was able to walk right in. Expect a wait if you are 2 or more people, but worth it.

QCd-wzSigfd7OCb4YlGjBA.text: Loved the ambiance, simplicity, and the steak itself! Though it is far from the best steak I've had, it was good and large enough to satisfy a steak craving. Make sure to keep your receipt to get your free ice cream on your way out!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Ice cream station
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

XurElhc-NSZx4ivQcw5AQA.text: This place is unreal. From the simplistic menu to the full flavour and tender steak this place is a must visit while in the UK. If you think their knives with the logos is amazing. Just ask and they'll set it to you for $10

S7WRm0NpKz4c2jykKp91Yw.text: If you have issues deciding on what to eat when starting at a 23 page menu (Cheesecake Factory, I'm looking at you), then the Flat Iron is your place.Only a few choices await you, but it you like the Flat Iron cut of beef, and what beefeater doesn't (see what I did there), the choices are all good.My wife and I ordered the Flat Iron and the Denver Steak, respectively, and both were cooked exactly to order and the A la Carte sauces we added (Bernaise and Peppercorn) were tasty and matched the beef well.You get a cute little micro-green salad in a cup and a small cleaver to cut your steak with.  While the cleaver is seriously cool looking, since their steaks are all served on a stone platter (slate?), the knife didn't have much of an edge to it and wasn't terribly effective. Luckily the steak is sliced on the bias already and was fairly easy to cut.I can also recommend the creamed spinach, as many others have. It was tasty and not too heavy.If you're a fan of beef, and don't feel like dropping £35 on a steak, the Flat Iron is an excellent choice to satisfy your protein cravings.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Mini cleaver from the Flat Iron restaurant.

7MdTLC4MEgQzj6A1y7zj6A.text: My friend and I were visiting from out of town and I follow this restaurant on Instagram and was dying to try the steak and chips and I was not disappointed... The food was amazing and so was the service I would definitely comeback and enjoy another meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

j8cvxQQBybw7dNqijSARoA.text: Simple menu, not much more to it than the flat iron. I ordered the flat iron and it was simple and magnificent. A side of horseradish peppercorn and I was loving life.

k4eA3oozNwo5m-2N8f5YFQ.text: Absolutely worth the wait.We had wonderful steak served with interesting plates and knives. Lots of shared seating so be prepared to sit with another group.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Little cleaver for a steak knife 3

Gu7E3wVRur4LunqgpNOmWA.text: The steak is cooked perfectly and very delicious. I think it's cute they serve salad in a cup.

x18GzEiyg4ljAqrH0GvNzQ.text: We chose Flat Iron in SoHo for our date night dinner while visiting London. They do not take reservations but when we arrived it was only a 10-15 minute wait for 2 people but I could see it being much longer for larger parties. The restaurant is quite quaint but that may lend to longer wait times. We both ordered the flat Iron. I had the peppercorn sauce (YUM!) and my husband had the bearnaise sauce, which he loved as well. The steaks came out perfect at medium rare which was suggested. We also ordered the creamed spinach, which was delightful and had a great texture. The star of the show, however, was the dripping fries. Y'all. These were the best fries I have ever eaten in my life. They were perfectly crispy and had the best flavor. I could have eaten my weight in these fries! The ambiance was wonderful (although a little hip and I am pretty sure we may not have been cool enough ha ha), the prices were more than fair and the food was delicious! A definitely go to!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Anywhere that starts with popcorn is a ok in my book!
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. So so good! Flatiron with creamed spinach and drippings fries
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. The menu

jiPhF8bVDHOGwsphBsDNoA.text: Truly one of the yummiest and most memorable steak experiences I've ever had and it was only 10 pounds! I definitely recommend adding a side of creamed spinach and a glass of red wine to go with the meal. It was a very satisfying and delicious meal. I was stuffed but very happy about it.The basement feels dark and at times warm, but it's a different atmosphere and quite hip.Best to come during off meal hours to grab a spot or dine solo for a likely guaranteed spot!

lWpAuaVszpllydaAUZa6dA.text: £10 for a steak? Yea please. This is one of the must visit London places you're always hearing about, simply because it's some fantastic value for money. I visited the new Covent garden outlet and was seated within 10minutes. You get exactly what you come for: a tasty, juicy flat iron cut steak  that leaves you satisfied but not too full. Not to mention, they even threw in a free ice cream! One of the coolest things about flat iron has to be their knives, which are specially designed and shaped like tiny cleavers. You'll never actually have to use them since they already cut the steak up for you nicely, but still, it's a very nice aesthetic touch to add on to the whole meaty atmosphere. If you're craving a steak at the end of the month, this is the place to go.

qZ54sDnbNSFG1Kko3thfCw.text: Flat Iron is a quality restaurant! The vibe is quite  chill, almost Lounge like. Very much a hipsters paradise. The menu is small, but the options are perfected. I had the classic Flat Iron Steak with a side of chips (French fries), Classic Peppercorn dipping sauce and a Rose Lemonade. All were delicious, The steak comes with a small (delicious) salad served in a cup. The total meal price was about £18 after tax and gratuity. The reason this isn't quite a 5 star experience is simply because within the  vicinity of Flat Iron, there are a handful of equally tasty and exceptional restaurants at a cheaper price. However that being said, if you are craving a delicious steak with a delicious dipping sauce and the oh so tasty Rose Lemonade, this is your spot!

JIAJZCP9-33f0nB5y9ZayQ.text: At first when walking in to Flat Iron I wasn't sure how I'd feel about the shared table setup, especially with the tables being so tight. After sitting down it was a complete non-issue. I loved the simple menu and the popcorn they bring out instead of bread. I ended up ordering the Irish Beef Belly special which was cooked a perfect medium rare and super tender then had chips on the side. Overall, the service was great, the food was great, will definitely visit again when I'm back in London.

53wa5yYJZGEia6cjF8Di1A.text: Amazing steak. The chips are good and the creamed spinach is amazing. You will not find a better steak for £10. I'd honestly go here over somewhere like Hawksmoor, it's that good.

YR5fOxFUTJeBkRdOedtkIA.text: Verdict: OMG YES!Pros:- Simplicity.- Rustic in terms of food, ambiance as well as décor. Très chic!- Wagyu Burger.- Fun and somewhat odd yet delish sides.- Popcorn made in beef broth.- Mini cleaver as knife is so cool.- Price.Cons:- 45 minutes wait on a Sunday evening, Blah! However since they do not take reservations it's bad thus fair for and to all.- I like salt, but maybe the kitchen should ease up a little on that front.- The steaks could be served hotter.

d1BEZX9hZMm2y4TR7UW95Q.text: The wait was long and the steak was small and of below average quality. It was not worth the money or time.I am suprized at all the good reviews.  Either most of the individuals have a poor taste in food or they are paid to write them.

nofA6DbI-63-FZvwifgCmw.text: Steak cooked to perfection, amazing ambiance, cheap house wine. What else to ask for?!

TNQczdN1xU53DpxrpME27A.text: What a find this was, all thanks to the wonders of yelp. 10 quid for a steak and a salad, great value anywhere never mind London.  The salad wasn't much to speak of, nice but mostly rocket and smallers leaves.  Limited selection of sides but all looked appetising, shared chips which were delicious. Please note, all the do us flatiron steak so if steak ain't ur thing don't come here. I'd never heard if a flat iron but it turned out to be a delicious cut, cooked to preference and perfection.I would highly recommend and the only reason it gets 4 stars is because all they do is steak, albeit deliciously.

GD78EjkudIH5CPoqRBkHDw.text: Turn up. Eat Steak. Flat Iron obviously. Get some sides. Cream spinach and chips. And be happy. Simplicity itself with concepts like Flat Iron. It's always popular which can be its downfall but that's no reason to put it down. Another good addition to this part of Soho.

jr5pbNzsr0aGG4PVU7shwA.text: It was a long wait for a table at Flat Iron. We missed our table because not all our party had arrived. But was advise to let them know when all party arrived and we would be in the queue for the next table - which we did. But it looks like they had forgotten our table as saw a table of six being given to another group.  May be they thought we were too comfortable in their bar downstairs. But we was hungry and they sold out of the savoury small plate served at the bar!Once we finally got a table upstairs, it was a sign of relief! The restaurant has three floors - downstairs is what is a bar area which could be used for dining. Then two floors which are seatings for dining.Although the special of the day was tempting I decided to go with their speciality - flat iron. You get to choose how you like your steak to be cooked. I asked the staff to advice and said medium rare was the best way to serve the flat iron, so went with the reconmendation. I was not disappointed it was a beautifully cooked flat iron and the steak was nice and tender. It did get slightly salted at time due to the sprinkle of flake salt. But it makes a different that you dont really need any sauce.Although we the flat iron come with some simple salad (that was over seasoned with vinger), we also ordered some sides to share. My favourite has to be the spinach and the baked aubergine.The presentation of the food is rustic and cool. The steak served on an iron board and the knief os a mini chopper knief. Also the price is really resonable for a steak. I will be returning (depending on the waiting time)!

iWuZXQjh4c3K6v9aawu1YQ.text: Great, simple, tasty meal. Who doesn't love steak, fries, and a side salad? And the best part is the free caramel ice cream at the end. Be prepared to wait in line if it's busy though!

3usSob7WC3MDQWDpv3Ohqg.text: Sunday lunch wait time was about 20mins. Put your name down and go walk around. They will send you a text message to return! It's a small cosy place, steak was good and the sides are huge. The cream spinach is a must try if you like some greens.

0bultVBJ9mt5-XPX_NEDbQ.text: A simple but spectacular meal! Perfectly cooked steak with a perfect sized portion of sides! Steak was very soft and tender and had been marinated very well. You didn't even need the sauce!

lkpCKKGS5qP4TwLzURMEGA.text: This is the Burger and Lobster of steak, essentially. Situated in central London, the quality of these dishes at the not-so-central-london prices makes for an amazing experience that definitely climbs the charts in the top cheap eats list. Also, I love the cutlery!

HamgVEX2jhmgvjg1WUbtgw.text: Absolutely love flat iron, good steaks, simple menu, quick service and lovely wine. I had the standard flat iron steak with a side of chips. Delicious. It would have got five starts but the seat I was on was in an awkward position. Nothing too bad and so popular that I was glad to have a good seat. I will definitely be going back and making sure to excuse myself from work a little early to make sure I get a good seat.

KW73V0CxYLgPhO4_1oNj3A.text: The fewer items on a menu, the more vital it is that things are cooked and presented well!  You can imagine when I arrived at Flat Iron and saw ONE main...I was nervous!  Well, I suppose it's two mains if you count the daily special.  As we waited for our table, we sat in the bar downstairs and sample a few bar snacks.  The first, air dried beef was not a winner for me - chewy with a strange flavour.  But the doughnut...slightly warmed, rolled in sugar, then filled at the bar with the filling of the day, last nights' being passion fruit, was a thing of magic.  Absolutely get the doughnut!The flat iron steak was fantastic, served medium rare as suggested, it was juicy, tender, and so flavorful.  Most of the sides we ordered were delicious, with the glaring exception of the salad with walnuts...or should I say 1 walnut?  (we didn't realise the steak came with greens already, so feel free to give this a miss anyway!)I didn't expect there to be any dessert on offer, but luckily we asked!  The waitress placed two little cups on the table (my skepticism growing...), then began to fill each with the piece de resistance...the salted caramel mousse...oh...em...gee - it was fabulous!!  Swirled high into the cup, and served with a little dish of salt to add at your leisure.  Creamy, light, sweet, salty, and unexpected.Great price as well, just over £60 for two, including a bottle of red wine.  Thanks Flat Iron!

ymFbDAvqmIYlLajraR7Z6Q.text: Went there just before 6 and thankfully there was no queue (since it was a little before busy time). This was our first time at Flat Iron and we were pleasantly surprised by the lack of choice on the menu - it made decision-making so much briefer and easier. The steak could have been a little on the hotter side but otherwise it was delicious. Also what would have boosted the experience is more upbeat, caring waiting staff.

MqJ6RVc3NqRg794oeFD09A.text: We loved this place! Came from Paris via Eurostar and went to dinner here on the first night based on the reviews of London restaurants. We were really impressed. Steak was like "butter." Delicious. My baby even liked the salad. He is typically steak and potatoes, but said "these leaves are really good!" Hilarious

JvOKYTYTEW_rtL_KD30a8A.text: We had the flatiron with bearnaise sauce, chips and market greens (purple sprouting broccoli for us). Steak was buttery soft and juicy, bearnaise had just the right tang and sides were delicious. My only quibble is the standard issue mini cleaver instead of a proper knife which is pretty much impossible to eat with so you just end up stabbing things with your fork. A bit uncouth for my taste! Go for the food though

JhOOkh2MiWhKQNB2L8sZPA.text: Incredible steak house, and very reasonably priced. The menu has very little selection which i think is a good thing - it means the chef can concentrate on perfecting the few things they have on the menu rather than trying to juggle a load of mediocre dishes throughout an evening.Instead of a basket of bread to start they serve popcorn cooked in beef juices which is wonderful. The house flat iron steak is tender and full of flavour and you can get a selection of sauces - I got peppercorn and my girlfriend got bernaise - both really tasty.I had a small carafe of house red wine which was delicious and went with the steak perfectly.Highly recommend!

lovIkRacrN6syXFIk2Ea5w.text: Tip: no draft beers available. Only bottle beers.At 11 pounds, the steak is actually a great deal.  Sure you pay for the sides and even the sauces.  You may have to sit next to strangers but it's a great experience for cheap tender steak.  Long lines everyday but moves along quickly.  Saturday night lines can be a 3 hour wait.Best sauce goes to peppercorn.  The cleaver is a total novelty item as the steak is already individually sliced.

4evE-l_bm_lbknq-1cMkDg.text: It was Halloween and I was craving a steak!  Flat iron showed up on good ole yelp and we headed over at lunchtime.  There was maybe less than a 5 minute wait and we were led to a table upstairs.  The server was super helpful and explained the menu to us.  The menu is on the wall, btw.  For around 10gbp, you get a decent sized steak with a salad.  We opted for one of those and also their special of the day, the ribeye.  Both were cooked a perfect medium rare.  We also added on dripping chips and kale with butter.  You could definitely tell the difference between the 2 steaks because of the quality and fat content.  The ribeye will always win, IMO.  Haha.  Peppercorn sauce was my choice.  For dessert, chocolate mousse.  I loved the butcher knife at the table which I actually used because the ribeye did not come out already sliced.  And guess what...it's not just a prop.  It works!  For under 40gbp, we had a delicious lunch and excellent service.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

BCFTxXJHarMnVwgCz3Bmgw.text: Somewhat of a letdown. Came here with my mom and we both ordered the flat iron steak cooked MEDIUM, dripping chips, and peppercorn sauce. I was really excited to try this place, reading the reviews made my mouth water.When the steaks came, mine was well done (cooked throughout with no pink at all) and my mom's was rare, red and bloody. We felt bad sending them back (something I almost never do) but both were not really edible to our preferences. Waitress was a little snooty about it but brought us two new ones, and these were actually both cooked to medium (hopefully with no spit for sending our previous ones back).The steak was fine but honestly nothing special. It could've used more salt sprinkled on top but for only 10 pounds, it was a good steak. No where near the best steak I've ever had, but better than any steak you can get in that price range at lowly diners elsewhere. The peppercorn sauce was fine, but if the steak was truly great, I wouldn't have needed the sauce to make up for some lack of flavor and add moisture. The dripping chips were also unremarkable. I appreciate that they were fresh and hot, but they tasted more or less like regular old fries.Overall, even when I got the steak cooked to my desired temperature, it was nothing to write home about. The only positive aspect is the affordable price - if it was priced higher, I probably would've given two stars. I was also glad I didn't have to wait long (came in at 5pm on a Saturday evening and only had to wait about 5 minutes), I would've been extremely disappointed if I had to wait a long time. Maybe next time, I'll try the ribeye.

x3q77zueRYpQJGh7eKQ4bA.text: Lovely place located in the soho area, excellent, soft steak for 11£ flat iron and 16 for ribeye what else can you ask for?If you want a nicely done steak, then this is the place to be, not too expensive and you get to choose if you want to have ur sides or omit it completely. I would say their french fries were really good... The steak comes with a complimentary sides salad already.Portion of the steak is acceptable in London, but would be a bit too small coming from someone who is here vacationing from at least the USA or Canada, however, it is delicious. Pair with peppercorn sauce and you won't regret it!. I also ordered a side of green beans, which I ask the server to bath it in butter, salt n pepper! Very fresh n nicely cooked as well. The mood in the restaurant is good and the best part of it? They got A/C therefore, that's a +++++. I would definitely recommend this place!

rRHATsdauVGueNpUWPjjyA.text: Amazing food!!! I'm taking my mom there when she visits :)Waitress was really nice as well, explained the meat selection and sauces. I got the lean steak along with the Creamed Spinach side and the Peppercorn sauce. I don't like spinach in general but the way they made it here (with cheese I think, or some cream sauce) was absolutely delicious! Steak was juicy and great quality as well. The sauce enhanced it, though by itself the steak was very tasty too. Will definitely be back!! :)

tjsl9xF9fmyuIwvgYmsnVA.text: You know a spot is good when they specialize in a one-item menu: The Flat Iron Steak (£11.00) with a house leaf salad side. Of course you also get a couple sides you can add on, which we did as well. We opted for the Dripping Chips Batch #128 (£3.50) and Creamed Spinach (£3.00). Both were delicious with the creaminess of the spinach and the crispiness of the chips making perfect companions to the steak. Don't forget to add on sauce for the steak as we both chose the Peppercorn sauce for an extra £1.00 --yum!I loved the presentation with the steak spread and even a cute, little cleaver although you don't even need since the steak is pre-cut for you. The medium rare came out perfectly pink on the inside for a delicious piece of meat. I was so happy that this was my first meal in London! The side salad was refreshing, but came in stocks of leafy greens that I found interesting. To pair with the entire meal, I had a Passion Fruit Fizz (£3.00). It was a bit on the sour side, but so authentic to the passion fruit flavor with a sliced of real passion fruit in my drink! Flat Iron is a must in London, for sure!P.S. They also have a downstairs dining area and restroom below, so don't be fooled by how tiny the restaurant may seem.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Medium Rare Flat Iron Steak with sides of Creamed Spinach and Dripping Chips Batch #128.
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Passion Fruit Fizz.
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Medium Rare Flat Iron Steak.

SwG8yZfxsM2g6J_KAPbv3w.text: I Love this place. I enjoy a nice walk from my business hotel to SOHO for dinner. Here it is a minimalist menu with a perfect steak and great additions like spinach or a choice of salads or French Frys etc. I really liked the flat iron steak with Sophie's salad. Added the peppercorn sauce on the side. Service is excellent, the staff is friendly and efficient. This location gets crowded and the line forms around 6pm. But with a little wait for a good meal in SOHO.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Healthy choice. Great steak and the Sophie's salad. Excellent!!!
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Line starts in the evening in SOHO but worth it.

Iu7g_cKMV35su2A6XQOG5g.text: Not much to say about it, it's okay for its price, the steak is not tender enough, not hot enough, ordinary.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

npV5IefM2M7mfYm8EG6qxA.text: Overall it is great. Very reasonablw price located in the heart of London. The quality of beef is marvellous. Meanwhile, service is great! It is a place that I will difinitely go back.

myQ-ceN2FqtU80fDpiEdHQ.text: Special-interest steak restaurant.  Basically they serve one steak: a piece of loin, I guess, about 6 or 8 ounces, already sliced.  So the cleaver (not a knife) which comes in your silverware isn't really necessary, which is good as it wasn't really useful either.  The meat was properly cooked and very tender.  You can order veggies on the side; I had creamed spinach which was pretty good.There were a couple other steak offerings available, one on the menu and one on the board.  I heard the waitress describe them to the next table after I'd ordered, and if only she'd done the same for me I might have ordered one of those.  But I'm not at all disappointed with what I did have.  I'll just have to come back some time and hope that one of these, or something else like them, is on the board that day.

a6VlxmeTXnUntfPzYXHEGQ.text: Overall it was great place and we can enjoy steak at good cost. The one we visited is closed to British Museum and we went there after visited B.M.  Besides the steak, the side dishes and sauces are good too ! Highly recommend for beef eaters!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

fRT1hlHkwZGfMErhwFx-Tg.text: We came here early, around 6pm, on a Monday night, before a show we were going to catch. We got the last table for two and the line up began. The restaurant already has two levels ~ so it's not exactly small. The menu is very simple ~ one main item: their iron steak. After, there are like five sides you can choose from, four sauces, and either yes or no for their dessert. As well, they do offer daily specials and a drink list. Next thing I want to mention is that their service here was awesome. Servers were friendly, happy, and knowledgeable. Food was very delicious and made on point. I highly recommend their fries, creamy spinach, and their horseradish sauce to accompany the steak. It was very reasonable and worth every penny. I am also a sucker on presentation of the food. So I was very impressed and definitely would recommend to family and friends. Just writing this review, its making me plan my next visit here already. So while you're reading this review, I suggest you to start making your way over before the line begins!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

b5vx23u2bpR_g6z2gj8oRA.text: Wow. What a wonderful surprise this was.  I was in the mood for Fish & Chips so my boyfriend and I wandered around Carnaby looking for a pub that was still serving.  There was only one and Michael decided he didn't like the attitude of the bartender or how she poured drinks and we could not stay. So we started wandering and happened upon Flat Iron.  We were just looking at the menu when the host popped out and said we could be seated in 5 minutes if we would like.  Michael, being the foodie that he is, was very intrigued by the fact the menu was so small.  I was still in the mood for fish so a bit disappointed to be going for steak but I am SO GLAD I didn't speak up about it.  This place is soooooo good. The ambience is great, the music is spot on and the staff is so friendly.  I'm also a popcorn fanatic (eating some now as I write this, to be honest) and I loved that there was a mug of it waiting for me when I sat down.  I had the flat iron with the peppercorn sauce and it just melted in my mouth.  I felt bad actually because it didn't even need the sauce, but the sauce was also so good that I couldn't not eat it!  They had a special burger that night so Michael got the burger with Bernaise sauce so we could each try something different and we also had the dripping chips.  Every bite we had was better than the first.  We had a lot of great meals while we were gone but this is the one we have discussed the most since returning.  Also LOVED the meat cleavers.  We bought a set to take home :) Michael is not a huge fan of London but I know dining here will soften the blow next time we come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Loved this back wall
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

25dMjLpSuDwDyEEeAmLDug.text: Flat Iron: so many good reviews and on a couple of lists as a "Not to be missed" place. As a result, it was a no-brainer to add Flat Iron to my list of London places to try. Unfortunately, experience fell extremely flat and did not make the long wait worthwhile.We came on a weekday night, late evening. There was already a wait, but we knew upfront so we were prepared for it. We waited over an hour, despite coming pretty late at night to avoid the usual dinner rush. They take your number to text you when your table is ready. One thing I noticed while waiting was their inconsistent treatment of customers. Some customers were allowed to wait inside, away from the cold, and when they were seated and inside was clear, they didn't allow other people to wait inside either, despite allowing people earlier. As I said, inconsistent.Once we were called in and seated, everything went downhill rather than up. They have a limited amount of servers. At first it seemed like only one server was working, because no one else came to us to take our orders. Apparently they don't take orders in which tables are seated or when customers are ready. We came in first out of 3 tables that were seated and we were the last to get our orders placed. I guess due to their popularity and limited space, they will seat multiple parties at one table, which is what happened to us. They seated us with another party of two and those two got better attention and service.  The menu is super basic: only one steak (£10), 3 sides (£2.5 - £3), 2 salads (£3.5), and 1 dessert (£2.5). Sauce for the steak is £1. The daily special, which has stayed consistent, is the New Zealand wagyu and it is only available medium rare. We picked their £10 steak, cooked medium, and the daily special plus some sides. Since there is a 100% chance you're ordering steak here, the utensils set out include a fork and mini butcher knife. They have popcorn in place of table bread. True to how the evening was going to be the rest of the night, our order did not come out right. When the steaks arrived, the flat iron steak that we ordered medium came out rarer than the wagyu, which was automatically medium rare. In fact, it wasn't even clear which steak was which when the server put down our orders because he didn't say what each steak was and he put the wrong sauces with the wrong steak. He put the flat iron sauce we ordered with the wagyu, even though he suggested it with the flat iron. There was not much service either. They cleared empty plates and asked if anyone wanted anything else at OTHER tables without anyone asking, but we had to fight hard to flag someone down to get the same level of service.I'm not a fan of things where you are automatically opted in and have to manually opt out. The optional charity donation is automatically added on bill, even though it is labeled as "optional." If it's optional, should it be up to the customer to ask to have it added on? That's what frustrates me in the States. We have these charities that come by neighborhoods and leave a flyer in your mailbox telling you that unless you tape the flyer to your curb, they will automatically come by and paint your curb and collect a mandatory donation from you for the unsolicited services. They automatically add you for a service unless you take the effort to opt out. The optional donation completely reminds me of that.Some other random things experienced: there is also an optional 12.5% discretionary service charge on the bill. They can't break change without someone else using the register to ring up a bill in cash.At the end of the night, I couldn't wait for the meal to be over. Despite the great price for the steak, the other aspects of this experience at Flat Iron felt like such a waste of my precious time in London. I did not return on my second visit to London the following year and I have no plans to ever return.

zjn-XW2CV1to13TLRinDiQ.text: Awesome! Definitely make reservations. Our server, Vanessa, was awesome. She's from Lisbon, and coincidentally by the end of dinner the parties seated next to us and behind us were from also from Portugal. That being said, dinner starts off with popcorn. The menu is very limited, but if you want flat iron steak, the menus PERFECT. We ordered two flat irons, that's served with small salads. We also order fries and the creamy horseradish sauce. The steak was really tasty and tender. For dessert we ordered the one dessert on the menu - a mousse with salty caramel sauce. The mouse is pumped into your dessert cup at your table and served with do-it-yourself salt. Excellent. And prices can't be beat. No wonder this place is always packed!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

Ye8azWCZC8NyS2WBlrUFig.text: The place is cool, the decor is nice and the steak is cooked excellently. It was soft and flavorful (I got the skirt steak). But I would say it's a little over priced, the rations are quite small. My boyfriend got the ribeye and it was tiny. The fries were okay, the creamed spinach was good. The steak is really the best part, I don't think the sides were out of this world, especially not for the price. The menu doesn't have many options either - just not be best bang for your buck

umKTKDm2zApl3x3in3UMvA.text: As London tourists, we wanted to try Flat Iron which people rave about on Yelp.  The wait was about an hour on a Saturday evening, but they do have a system where they text you when your table is ready so we just explored the area until we were summoned.  We were seated in the basement where we felt our table was a bit too close to our neighbors (might have been 1 inch between the tables).  Just something to consider if you like your space like we do.We ordered two Ribeyes with Bearnaise sauce and Fred's sauce as well as a side of fries.  Popcorn was provided as service while the food was being prepared.Ribeyes:We ordered them medium-rare.. and to our surprise they were both cooked to an exact medium-rare!  We were very delighted as many steak houses mess this up often.  The iconic cleaver-knife made eating this a breeze and the steak was seasoned perfectly.  The plate it was brought out on also had a wow factor.  Bearnaise:Rich and delicious, by the end of our meal there was none left.Fred's sauce:Not my favorite, however my partner thought it was OK. Fries:Surprisingly the weakest point of the dinner.  They did not taste good at all.. My hunch is that they used old oil to cook our fries since we were one of the last customers that night.  Also they weren't well-seasoned but we have no point of reference for British fries, maybe that is normal?The service was fantastic, our waiter was very welcoming and kind.  We can tell why this place is so successful.  Overall, we had a fantastic experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Ribeyes, fries, bearnaise, Fred's sauce

dQ_j25-mcx_bQWN_kmCJ7A.text: I write this review with mixed feelings. I dined here almost a year ago to the date and everything was amazing. So much so that I've wanted to come back ever since. And so on my most recent trip to London, after a 45 minute wait I was seated and eagerly awaiting my steak. Unfortunately this time round I found the steak to be chewy, some pieces were too chewy to even eat and I was so disappointed. On top of that, everything seemed over salty which wasn't very enjoyable either.However I must say, our servers were very lovely. My friend and I ordered the dessert to share which is basically a chocolate mousse that is actually prepared in front of you out of a whipping cream canister. I may be wrong but I think she gave us an extra big portion as she knew we were sharing :-)Anyways, I wouldn't not recommend Flat Iron. At £10 a go not every steak is going to be perfect and maybe yours will be!

B6WInWfD7Io0tTlQO3Dk3Q.text: Hands down, the best meal that I had throughout my weeklong stay in London.I actually found out about Flat Iron through one of the accounts I was following on Instagram. I saw steak for 10 pounds and I was immediately sold. So three of my friends and I made our way over for dinner on a Monday night at around 6. They don't take reservations, and the place is super small, so we were told that the wait would be an hour and a half. That was fine because they took our number and said they'd text us when our table was ready. Plus, we weren't that hungry anyway. The tables are a bit like cafeteria-style seating. Aside from two round tables in the back, there's probably about 4 of them, which seats 6 each and yes, you will likely be sharing the table with randos.The menu is simple. There are a few sides you can order but as for the steak, there's only one option, which is their 'Flat Iron' steak. It comes with a side salad. Order the doneness to exactly how you would like it. Flat Iron is on point. I ordered a medium-rare and it came out exactly as that. The size is a good portion. I could have used a little bit more but then again, I can always use more steak. I left feeling satisfied - definitely get a side to share.I'd also would recommend the Spicy Italian Negroamaro. It tasted really smooth and of course, paired well with the steak.For the quality and the price, you really cannot go wrong here. You would definitely not find a place like this in NYC - it would be double the price, at least. If I ever come back to London, I will definitely make it a point to come back to Flat Iron.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

ZWCpIKTfZGFHWCbVv8jJaA.text: Went here after reading a lot of positive reviews online. I was expecting pretty good steak, but what I got was honestly some of the best steak I've ever had. When a restaurant has few items on the menu, you can only hope what they do make is the best. With Flat Iron, they make only the best. The flat iron steak was rich with flavor and melted in my mouth with every bite. I had a side of Peppercorn sauce that was also delicious, but honestly the steak is so good on it's own you really don't need any sauce to add flavor. Service was quick and friendly and this has become my favorite restaurant I've eaten at while visiting London.

RUl5FXnA0vHMyzcdcufeLQ.text: My thought process:Me: "Ooooohhh... steak...." "Mmmm..." "Ooooooohh, only £10?!""Is this really cow... or is it horse meat??"Har Har Har. I know, it's a low blow in light of the recent horsemeat scandal but £10 for steak in London is UNHEARD of. My friend and I came in and put our name on the waitlist and we were quoted that it would be an hour wait. They were right. We came back right on time and were seated shortly after. There's only one thing on the menu and that's a flat iron steak. I ordered mine medium and added a salad and peppercorn sauce on the side. The flat iron steak was good, although I wished I ordered mine medium rare like my friend did. I thought his was a little better. That peppercorn sauce though... OMG it's mouth-watering good. I also tried Fred's sauce which has a bit of a kick, but the peppercorn came out as the clear winner in my book.Get your booty to Flat Iron, put your name on the list, and get ready to enjoy a £10 steak next to a bunch of people you don't know.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Mmmm

uCFeVE5sVMhdeVqM2oBiEw.text: A beautiful setting in soho, the staff were truly helpful and the bar downstairs was gorgeous. The evening started off on a positive, now the food!!I'd heard about this place through friends and thought it's got to be good. The steak was amazing and the fries were to die for too. We also had asparagus as a side which went down a treat. The only thing was, I needed more food because it was so good!! One word of advice, the Fred spicy sauce for the steak we were recommend was not as good. I'd stick to the regular sauces.If you've not been, head over and enjoy a good quality steak for £10

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

boXfYAqvb7rvEzuQLHnEMQ.text: I love nothing more than a big, juicy steak, so when I recently met my parents in London for a bite to eat I knew straight where to head.Flat Iron, on Beak Street in Soho, is a one-dish concept restaurant with steak as its speciality. Diners can chose between the name sake option, a £10 Flat Iron steak with salad (which is incredibly good value) or opt for one of the daily specials. Feeling rather ravenous, my step-dad and I opted for one of the specials of the night - a glorious piece of rare rib eye steak for two the share.  My mum went for the speciality flat iron and we ordered dripping cooked fries, aubergines roasted with parmesan, tomato and basil and creamed spinach to be shared amongst us. I also opted for a béarnaise sauce to go with my steak - I'm addicted to the stuff!One of my favourite things about Flat Iron was the communial eating space, we shared a long bench with three guys who were having a university reunion - they roped up us in on horror stories of their antics and the trouble which they'd got themselves into over the years. We also shared favourite restaurants and they suggested Baltic be added as the next on our go-to list.They don't take bookings, but you can pop your name on a list and head to the basement for a few drinks whilst you wait as we did - I recommend the strawberry and basil collins. Flat Iron are a social bunch so keep an eye on their twitter to find out more about the daily specials

ocF-SECqffi9DJ5PreuEMA.text: This place has to be a current favourite of mine (despite the long wait - try the Coffee House - good for a pre dinner G&T)I had a super date here and now have had a great night out with friends. I don't claim that this is the best steak in London, however it is really flavoursome and well cooked..Well priced - although everyone should have beef dripping  chips each,  plus a side- creamed spinach is my fav.Great buzz and good Negroamaro (I had the cheaper last time which was fine, and the more expensive this time which was a little jammy but matched the steak well and has much more intensity)Leave room for puddings (yes multiple) have the creamy caramel squirty thing, with lots of salt, first; then head downstairs to the "Doughnut Bar"! This alone as a concept I think could make millions. Just me?I enjoyed the perfect pairing of a rhubarb and custard hot doughnut with a super old fashioned a great end to any evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. The best way to end the night

7TVxsfQHBD8NyhwfHeI5hw.text: By far my favourite place for steak in London so far, love the atmosphere, love the food and love the cocktails!!You cannot book for this restaurant so you may have a bit of a wait, would advise going a bit earlier than planned to avoid eating too late! I have been a couple of times now, the first time, we went at the busiest time, and had a 40 min wait, but it was definitely worth the wait! We were given a buzzer and waited downstairs in the underground bar, which has a great atmosphere, quirky basement style, with delicious cocktails! Back in the restaurant you're given a little bucket of popcorn while your waiting for your food, which is tasty and a bit different from your standard bread basket. There isn't much choice on the menu, but what they do serve is delicious, the flat iron steak is served pre cut, its just SO juicy and melts in the mouth!! Would recommend the dripping cooked chips and creamed spinach as sides, both very yummy! And my absolute favourite is the béarnaise sauce, served in a little jug so you can have just the right amount! Before you leave, you may also want to pop down to the underground bar as they serve, delicious warm doughnuts with a passion fruit curd, perfect for afters if you're still hungry!!Lastly, the only downside for me is despite the good atmosphere, it is communal seating on benches, which i personally find makes my back hurt, but thats just me, no one else seems to have a problem with it!!

IgETkRguF-NrawQqmZ-B0w.text: The steak was quite good a little on the chewy side but worth the money.  The roasted aubergine with tomato basil and pama was excellent.  The wine we ordered complement the steaks. The peppercorn sauce and Fred sauce was nice and spice to it

6bpd9XWYjGTuOhl1z9yixQ.text: Had a great night at Flat Iron.Firstly, throughout the night all members of the staff were so incredibly pleasant, they were great. We (ok, my friend, I was late as usual) got there about 1830 and were told it would be 15-20 minutes for a table. It was longer than that but we didn't care because the basement bar is a really pleasant place to wait as opposed to the street which is your fate at Meat Liquour, Pitt Cue Co et al. There's actually space to sit down and you can watch the bar staff struggle with the giant block of ice they chip bits off. The restaurant itself is pretty cramped, we were seated in between 2 couples on dates which was pretty funny as my friend and I were much more relaxed (and dancing in our chairs...the music was awesome). The steak was very good and as I had inadvertently had a very late lunch I didn't have the problems with portion size that a couple of other reviewers mentioned! The chips also went down well, as well as the aubergine side which was a nice unusual pairing with steak. I went for the peppercorn sauce but would recommend Fred's sauce, which was a delicious concoction somewhat reminiscent of a Bloody Mary, I suspect Tabasco is involved.I think what sealed the deal for me with Flat Iron was the £2.50 doughnut we had for dessert downstairs back in the bar. Yes, that is pretty expensive for a doughnut but we got to watch it be pumped with rhubarb custard filling (you can specify how many pumps) and overall I liked the concept. I think that's what I took away from Flat Iron in general - maybe not totally outstanding food in all honesty but I like the concept, I like their attitude and I hope they do well.

r3xP6awoSlWL-z7gWsjkvw.text: Anyone who knows me if nothing else know one thing above all else, I am a carnivore! Unashamedly! A Monday night dinner in Carnaby warranted steak, a friend of mine made the call and we agreed to meet around 6pm at the restaurant. So the 1st thing to note is they don't take reservations, the 2nd is they won't seat you until your group have all arrived. If you are stuck waiting go to their basement bar, they have a happy hour 2 for 1 deal that is very worthwhile.To the steak, as per the name....flat iron! They also do a cut of the day but we all went flat iron. For your £10 you get steak and a small green salad all other sides are extra. We went for beef drilling chips, aubergine roast and French beans. All delicious.The steak is cared for, seasoned and cooked to perfection. They really know what they are doing! I love it and I will be back! Flat Iron is Highly Jd Recommended!

tTEJ0Ar5QfcpiA9c0JcZCQ.text: It's been a while since I went to Flat Iron but I find myself recommending it to my friends time and time again.I knew of it's reputation before my visit so after having a drink with my friend on Old Compton Street we made our way over an hour before we wanted to eat in anticipation of queues (even though it was a Wednesday at 6pm).The place was much smaller than I had pictured in my head, but we took our buzzing table alert thingymabob and descended into the basement bar. The cocktails were well made and strong. The price was typical of the area but a step up after the happy hour offers nearby. I liked the sound of the bar food they had on offer too but decided to forgo them to save room for the main event. After about 45 mins our gizmo started to flash so we went up to our table. Again, I was surprised at just how small the place is. We were wedged between two rather gregarious couples and only at this point did I realise how restricted the menu is. You could have a flat iron steak (which they say is cooked medium-rare unless you would prefer otherwise). The special was a burger. Then there were a handful of sides.My friend and I both ordered the steak, naturally, along with a side of chips and spinach and at this point you see why it's so popular. The steak isn't a big cut but it is juicy, seasoned well and just generally tasty. It's also extremely good value.Why the missing star? I've had even better steaks for even cheaper in London (albeit out in Mile End) and I don't like it when I can't reserve a table and therefore have to wait for something like 45 mins.

Hh-pf55GY2AD_aDYoioC_w.text: Flat iron is yet another player in the "we are only going to offer you one item on our menu" movement that is taking over London. In this case the item is steak. Yes, it's inexpensive at £10 but the portions are almost comically small. That said, the steak is good and was properly cooked to my asking.Service was "awkward" ... unclear if thats because the wait staff was new, but our waitress was hard to understand and we constantly had to ask her to repeat even the most basic of items, which is odd considering only steak is on the menu. Agree with Tristan that the sides (we had the seasonal greens and the chips) were un-rememberable.As Flat Iron doesn't take reservations, expect to wait a while. There is a cash-only bar downstairs to keep you hydrated while you wait.Overall, this is 3 stars in my book -- it's ok, certainly not expensive, but I don't get the hype or the why people would wait 2 hours for a small steak...

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Steak
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. steak

dF1hG8v1SsGc5wb1o5yLtQ.text: Went here for lunch today on a whim as I couldn't find my intended lunch spot in Carnaby Street.  I heard about this 'quality steak for a tenner' spot for a while, so was happy to detour and try for the 1st time.First impressions: cramped.  I went solo, and it seems all of the tiny 6-seater table sections are communal.  The intimacy (and occasional elbow-bumping) you'd expect eating with a group of friends you're now experiencing with total strangers...not sure if that's my thing.Flatiron's amuse bouche of choice is beef dripping popcorn served in a farm-chic mug and, along with the headlining entree itself, was the meal's highlight item.  I ordered the staple flatiron steak (comes with salad) for £10, plus a £1 'Fred's sauce' and £2.50 for dripping cooked chips, which sounded absolutely amazing.Once all the food arrived, a roller coaster of emotions ensued.  Salad = screams 'we picked this from a Sainsbury's salad bag and put a little vinaigrette on it'Dipping cooked chips = McDonald's fries.  There was absolutely nothing special about them, no signs of them being cooked in beef drippings, and portions were meager.Steak = saved the experience.  The steak was definitely good- tender, juicy with delicious salt flecks on top...no condiments necessary.Fred's sauce = wtf.  It was a reddish sauce that tasted of strong spicy mustard, and I didn't think it went well with the steak at all.  i really wanted to love this place, but I don't.  I will give them props for making the 'main thing' a worthy bite to eat, but not enough for me to yearn for a return visit.

KSVbLr1INKGWSGm0WNXHeg.text: Absolutely love it here- great value for money, the steaks are good, the sides are good, the staff are lovely. There can be a long wait- but that's no problem as they have a basement bar to pass some time.I'm definitely going to be a regular visitor!

dfg5z1yXGAmCWBI1VFAXeQ.text: Shot my evil vegetarian side in the gut there, twice.  Lovely beef cooked and seasoned well.  Good Cornish flat iron cut and good Cornish cider.  Simple veg.  Fantastic, just fantastic.  If you're in Soho, you must.  Lovely hospitality and a great atmosphere.  Sat at the bar downstairs, perfect.  Popcorn to start!!

hBY6tP_g180afmU56OWXmA.text: Great meat place. The place serves very few dishes but it does them well. Unique design and serving. The butcher knife provided instead of a standard knife is a cute touch. Great value for money.

ESHqaZU8dq8Z_WlRW9986Q.text: The first thing that only makes Flat Iron 'A-OK' is the fact you cannot book a table in advance. This gets on my nerves at any restaurant that restricts you from this. Customers are looking for a relaxed experience when they are dining out, and it is a big shame that Flat Iron makes you feel rushed and stressed even before you've sat down to eat.Unfortunately, after ordering a steak each and a side each, Flat Iron forgot our order.
