We were left waiting with no food for about 30 minutes, until someone came over to ask if we were okay. We stated that our food hadn't arrived, and then discovered that they'd completely missed our order after we had ordered.The staff were apologetic, and offered us our cocktails on the house, but it was still disappointing that this had happened.Although the steak, when it eventually arrived, did have a lovely texture and great flavours, it was a bit on the small side. If you're paying £10 just for the steak, it was a bit of a shame it wasn't a big larger... All in all, it was an okay experience, nothing to rave out, and I'd only go back if someone else suggested it - I would never suggest to go there myself.

sfzIhqtBw6wnkxc1DIBJjQ.text: First time in London and came across this restaurant while walking around. Figured we would give it a try since we were craving some steak. So glad we tried it because it was one Amazing steak! First time here today and highly recommend this place. Ordered the Flat Iron steak with peppercorn sauce, and a side of their chips. It also comes with a small side salad. Medium rare= perfection. Along with a glass of white wine which tasted great. Boyfriend ordered the same steak with a side of cabbage and a different sauce. Both tasted so damn good! I was so impressed with this place that I would go back again. Service was exceptional- our waitress was so friendly, helpful, and attentive. Cool restaurant atmosphere. They serve you popcorn when you first get seated. It was getting crowded already when we arrived around 3:30  pm so I can imagine how busy it gets at night and on weekends. Cash only. Definitely will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Flat iron Steak with peppercorn sauce and side of chips

5Zvvxiu_rg_HpiYstP--VA.text: My favorite place in London. The meat is fantastic, service is good, and the peppercorn sauce is to die for!

2z2qRJt19zLUseQrvX_MQg.text: Big queue but managed with sms notifications when your turn comes. Very friendly staff. Great side dishes.

uqsTyDqlH6p1NY7g-jXj1A.text: Great quality food for a cheap price. It gets very busy and they dont take bookings but if you arrive early enough you will be seated straight away. Otherwise its worth the wait! Their steaks are delicious!

rg9Rsl3gpG2PgMnBs_oveg.text: After having a difficult week I really wanted to treat myself and had heard great things about Flat Iron. I knew it would be difficult, especially on a Friday night, to get in so (expecting a 2 hour wait), I headed over early to put my name down while I waited for my boyfriend. They have a great system where you put your name down and they text you when your table is ready. At around 6 pm the wait for a table for 2 was about 45 minutes, but actually ended up being more like 30 minutes, by some miracle. Unfortunately, my boyfriend was running late so I decided to wait in line again to put my name down one more time. This time it was a 2.5 hour wait. When I got to the front I explained that we had a spot but weren't sure if they still had our table. It was a HUGE gamble but luckily they still had spots at the bar downstairs. This was 15 minutes past our time so I was beyond excited for this to have happened. Now the food! We ordered the steak, obviously, the fries and the bernaise sauce. While we waited we munched on the popcorn they give to every table, sort of like bread you'd get in an Italian restaurant, which is fantastic. Another really cool feature were the cleavers you use to cut the meat. They are adorable and can even be purchased "as a souvenir". When the food arrived it looked amazing! I tried a few fries first and they tasted nice :) I then tried the steak... WOW! It was absolutely amazing and perfectly prepared. It was probably one of the best steaks I have had in London. So tender and flavourful, from a fairly cheap cut of beef. We were both so impressed with the food and the price as well. We also got a nice salad which was a lovely addition. Normally I don't like mustard but I did enjoy it. Needless to say it was incredible and I definitely would recommend it! (Just get there early)

bdQ9wco2WNNgdaDY2jVRIw.text: Best value for a great steak I've had in a long time. Grain fed beef, cooked medium, and it was fantastic! Fries and salad are great, also. Thanks, yelp, for leading me to another great out of the way gem! A buddy with me ordered medium rare and it was not nearly as good as the medium. (Waiter suggested medium rare, but not a good idea.)

43fKdGKUKY9xsRbq2f5xrQ.text: Like most people, I went to Flat Iron based on word of mouth and what my friends had said. £10 a steak was too good to miss.The wait for a table was not too bad, as you can drink in a nearby bar and they text you when a table is ready. Not so good when you give them the wrong number though, as I did, and had to go back to ask them to change it.The venue is small, so we shared a table with 2 others. It was a bit intimate, and we could hear their conversation, but it made the whole experience a bit more sociable. It did feel, however, that you were on a production line - queue up, get seated, order, pay and go. The members of staff were very nice but were keen to get you served - and possibly out the door and free up a table - quickly.The food was good, and the popcorn as a appetiser was a great idea. The steak itself - the big star of the show - was a somewhat small portion, although expected for only £10. It tasted amazing, but was served on a wooden slab with a mini meat cleaver which felt a bit gimmicky. The portion of salad was a nice touch but hardly worth the bother.A nice place to try out but I would probably seek out another steak restaurant next time.

U4TQYdEfQXi-svJyfLp5fA.text: It is actually not as cheap as you may assume. The little piece of meat (I wouldnt call that a steak) eventhoug it's ok is not enough for a normal person,  (maybe for a small children) and the meat does not include anything (but a green three leaves salad) you have to order the sides which are not cheap and also are to small

b_6Ibr7Xz0s2aKaogqwVRA.text: Came from the word of mouth by friends and true enough YUMM! Lucky me since I came at lunch time before the crowd, no waiting time.They had me with the popcorn 'appetizer' because never have I ever had this cute lil surprise before! Then I enjoyed a medium-well done with peppercorn sauce and chips (which made me felt too full after that popcorn). Will I come back? For sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. I am a butcher!!

TlG2TNAzuym2dhS0tMMk-g.text: the food was fine but not as good as what others have said. However, I really liked the idea of complimentary ice creams on our way out!

vGzUaEmyTmBAWD-XAwV2zw.text: Just had an amazing meal.  Had to come home and nap afterward.  The entire staff is super friendly and personable.  I was waited on by Carlo (sounds like???).  He's blond, tall, animated and jacked -- I tried not to blush when he described the shoulder cut and flexed his tricep.    The popcorn is a cute touch.  The meat cleaver knife is hysterical.  You won't need it for the steak -- but I did chop my watercress salad with it.  The steak was done to perfection with a lemon zest sea salt.  Course and briny.  And the dessert is poured table side.  A delicious chocolate sea salt caramel mousse with more sea salt served on the side.Excellent choice of beers, an IPA from Beaverstown and a Saison from Partizan.  The Bernaise sauce was off the hook, as was the creamy Aubergine.  I was told to come back for the creamed spinach.  You can bet I will.Incredibly priced.  My whole meal, an 8oz steak, a large side, a gratis watercress balsamic salad, popcorn, two beers, dessert and gratuity was £26... Unreal!Will be back!

c5ahhBLoKPgQ53vtbZmMNg.text: What a great place to eat a tender piece of meat (with a mini cleaver) and also get treated to a delicious home-made salted caramel ice cream on a cone with chocolate bits on the top. A really reasonably priced meal!  Get the chips on the side along with a glass of beer and you'll be very pleased with your meal.  Would definitely come back the next time we're in London.

i7kc_qhxIv9nqIsinxjzgQ.text: Where to start... Ok, so people have been talking about Flat Iron for a fair few months now - "It's this amazing steak place that does steak for just £10 and it's really good", "you have to go, it's so good" - you know, the usual. So Alex and I decided to give it a try before our theatre trip and being a huge steak fan I was rather excited!We arrived and were told the wait was 15 minutes - absolutely fine by us. We were asked to provide our telephone number and they said they'd text us when our table was ready. After 15 minutes (exactly) we were texted and we headed back to claim our table, but wait, it wasn't our table, it was ours, the couple to our rights and the two friends on our left. That's right, we were sandwiched between 4 people and when I say sandwiched I mean every move we made we were nudging into someone. It was uncomfortable and kind of tainted the romantic date night I'd had in mind...What I will say however is that their steak is good! We opted for the original steak and also their special Wagu NZ steak. With sides of chips, spinach and market greens.Free popcorn is provided as a tasty treat to start - gotta love popcorn, especially when it's free! Then the food followed quickly...Both types of steak were cooked beautifully, for me the Wagu steak stood out, it was succulent, with a slight smokiness to it - just really good meat. The original was also really tasty and for £10 you can't really beat it.The sides were also good - the chips were slightly cold sadly but I what I will say is that the market veg is the bees knees - buttery, crunch, green goodness in the form of cabbage! I also ordered a side of peppercorn sauce which was damn good! Many places struggle with peppercorn but the consistency, and taste was just spot on. Overall it was just a very mixed experience. The food and service (our waitress was lovely - very friendly and helpful) was of a great standard but I just didn't like the way the restaurant was laid out and I don't want to be listening to other people's lives stories of how they're craving a burger because it's their time of the month (true fact). I've given it a three - it would be 3.5 if I could, I just don't think it lived up to the hype.Sadly, I'd be in no rush to go back and if I was to go back it would be at 3 in the afternoon on a Monday. Can we have our own table please?

D8EE9QPwPwr-M56ao7Qe6Q.text: What an amazing place!!!Definitely the place for steak lovers who are not wheeling to get out of budget ... the steak itself was just perfect and the ice cream at the end was brilliant

o53ZKxKOdUrQSzwELXgITA.text: Very simple menu - good because you don't have trouble choosing which one to eat. Good price with mid size of steak, very friendly staff. Recommend homemade basic and strawberry soda!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

tfEUNvN7IZ3Ib6zLLgRe5g.text: The food was outstanding and the service was great.  We found it interesting that they will seat other people with you as they will utilize all of their seats.  Highly recommend!

2rpx17bzJnIEY0WLYuSlhA.text: The food was great! It was worth waiting.But the protein was a bit bland and the blood was a bit more towards rare when mid-rare was ordered. The protein was very tender for sure.The taste of salads was very well balanced.The steak was served a bit like to someone who is on diet... A bit disappointed....

EhWK62vdKRdTXC_QVec1Ug.text: Simplicity is by far one of the most under-rated qualities.  Flat Iron nails simplicity in the very complex steak market.  They do NOT sacrifice flavor, execution and ambiance. In fact they don't sacrifice ANYTHING.Now here is the AMAZING part. They revolutionize a long established business practice.It is a must try. They do NOT take reservations and you might need to wait. But the wait, food and price point are worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

rsd_Rdtt3GCTaxkFqAJKmg.text: Very simple menu -- steak and sides -- and all delicious. It was very easy to eat Paleo or even just gluten-free. Loved that they had a mug of popcorn in place of what at another restaurant might have been a basket of bread. For the three of us, we ordered one flatiron, one special steak (skirt steak), and four sides, and that was plenty. Didn't try the dessert (chocolate salt caramel mousse) but was tempted.

tyNLx1QcOKANl-1VLzMi-A.text: So far Flat Iron has been my favourite steakhouse in London considering its cool vibe, good background music, reasonable prices, relaxed approach, friendly staff and what is the most important - it's delicious juicy beef steak with yummy sides and sauces. Creamy spinach side is my personal favourite and is a must try. The only issue with Flat Iron is that one cannot get in whenever wanted as long as it doesn't do reservations. But that makes the craving for it even bigger and is definitely worth the two hour wait. So you can either leave your mobile number in order to receive a text message later on with an invitation or wait in the bar downstairs. They have a cute cellar bar downstairs which makes it easy to pass the waiting time. Once you agreed to wait in the bar, you will be handed a pager which beeps when your table is ready. A cupful of popcorn and a jar of water will already be waiting for you on the table when you arrive. The tables fit 6 people so unless you come in a group of six, you will be sharing your table with the others, which can turn out to be a good place to meet new people ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. The steak is the best when it is done medium rare
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. If you want a separate table you will most probably not going to have one unless you come in a group of six
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. The sides: creamy spinach is a must try

c87kyHF-k97Q1EJ7G1wPKg.text: A nice casual steak house. You do have to wait for a bit for the table, luckily the host will text you and let you know when the table's ready. They serve you popcorn before the meal arrives. The steak comes with a side salad. Very decent steak for the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

5Ns9HKfM3uVQ8bSDQFikGw.text: Finally tried Flat Iron as have heard good reviews before but must say I want impressed. Considering there's only one thing on the menu you would of thought it'll be amazing?? My at be the standard item,  we went for the special which saw Cornish Skirt Steak.. Cooked only medium rare they said... Well mine was over cooked... The dripping fries felt like it was cooked in old oil taste... And the grilled aubergine was more burnt... But the lighting in the restaurant was dark so I guess you're not suppose to see it? Can't say I will be running back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Cornish Skirt Steak

Nr0qvItoI-f5Rnd2YRfZ7g.text: Apparently the good place to come for steak with reasonable price in London? :PCame here for pre theater meal with friends. The restaurant is small and already half full at around 5 pm? I can imagine the crazy wait during peak hours! We all ordered the famous steak. It is small and thin to American standard, but cooked perfectly and very juicy and tender! BTW the knife they provided was so cute and cool looking, but the steaks were already cut for us! I wish I could use the cute knife!The steak came with a cup (literally) of salad, which I like very much! We also ordered fries to share. There's free pop corn! Which is pretty unique!

2a23hOEJriMvZDr9U8oLRA.text: I suppose it is the crazy buzz about this place - it sets expectations high.  I would have given a 3.5 rating if I could.  The food is actually good and the portions are a bit on the smaller side but that is to be expected considering the quality of steak and the price - so I have no qualms with that.  The restaurant is tiny - and the seating is uncomfortable and made to get you out of there asap rather than linger.  While I understand that, going out for a meal is more than just the food - it is the ambience, the service, and how comfortable your seating/table is (not very comfortable is the answer).  I found myself very conscious not to bump the person next to me while eating - it detracts from the experience.  So the food is lovely, if you are reallllly hunger opt for a few side dishes, you'll need them.I might be back - but I'm not rushing..

PZS4yg4bE28qpLViORLrPQ.text: So just a quick heads up! We went for lunch (Mainly because we couldn't be asked to wait the 90ish minutes the night before) when it is considerably quiter than dinner."Cheers for the information which doesn't add anything to the review kid."I think it does, I had a really good experience and the quality of the food I had was great. I can see the reasoning in others people's reviews who had to wait 2 hours. Obviously the restaurant was a lot busier  then and as a result with something like steak you could argue that there is a higher chance of the food tasting a bit worse (resting time, stress etc.)Anyway, a 10ball for a steak and some chips? Yes please! Did they really try and upsell me Wagyu for double the price? Nice try.. (Don't kid yourselves, the normal steak is most definitely good enough and there's not much justification for paying for the higher teir one in my opinion.)I bought a sauce (Bernaise) because I always have Bernaise whenever I can get it with steak and chips (Minority or majority here?! Answers on a postcard please..).Steak was great, cut up into decent sized pieces. I feel that if it wasn't cut up I would of finished it in half the time (I'm such a slob I know..). It's not massive, but it's only a 10ball and you can always get another one (one of my friends did).Anything was of a great quality and for the price and experience I can't give it any less than 5 stars.Definitely a place to try if in the area!If you have time maybe go to the door at 6 and put your name down, should save you some waiting.

oBzVRVjAtuOC2hEWLan9LQ.text: The steak is soooo tender seasoned and cooked to perfection. I have been in London for three days and this steak was the best thing I have had. It is without a doubt one of the best steaks I have ever had. With that being said, now the cons. The steak is served with a cup of greens with some dressing over it, and that is all. If you want "chips" aka french fries with your steak it will cost you an additional £2.50 and sauce flavors cost an additional  £1.00. I must say, they do have the BEST chips I have had in London. Another con is the food all came out luke warm. If that baby would have come out piping hot, it would have tasted so much better. Also, a steak that wonderful should have the option to be pared with a baked or "stuffed" potato.Be prepared to wait. My pary and I had to wait an hour and a half to eat. Overall, pretty solid food, respectable atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. The steak.

pnagpf7eS6XogdeZYhbjWQ.text: Simple menu, but that isn't a bad thing! They know what they've perfected, and they are damn good at it. Awesome vibe on the inside and in a great location.

mZmcVZoq7X_mtIAQjgX_Cg.text: Went here for dinner last week and it was nothing short of amazing! We shared the special steak for two with a few sides and a carafe of red ... It was delicious. Couldn't recommend it more highly. I will definitely be making a return trip!!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. One of the best steaks i've had in my life! You did not disappoint Flat Iron!

r1D8scqkghpYmm6C-K8LFg.text: Great place, great service and great price. Only 2 kinds of steak but was amazed how good the flatiron steak was. we had a party of 4 and waited 1.5 hours having drinks nearby. everybody enjoyed the meal and that was a big part of a great night.

uLn5Z7h_SfglH-r8UfE9mw.text: The steak is always delicious whenever I head to FlatIron. My favourite thing about FT are all the craft beers and delicious wines that you can have with your steak.I haven't tried any of he specials yet, but from what my friends have told me, the burger is delicious.The chips are on point always, with a different member of the team making it each day?The only annoying thing is that it is near impossible to get a table for dinner at an appropriate time. I always find myself going to Flat Iron after the lunch rush or before the dinner crowd. If not you'll need to wait for hours. The seating arrangement can be a little cramped, especially during the cold months when everyone has a huge coat or jacket.The price is very very very decent and I always try to take people there if there isn't a long line.All in all the food outweighs the negatives.

s7HaKyWh54dtDEShoC3t_A.text: This place is 5-stars for many reasons. Great steaks. You can have steaks with your choice of sauce and one side under £15. They serve popcorn instead of bread to start. You have variety of options for the side and the sauce.I had peppercorn sauce with my steak which was awesome, and creamed spinach for the side which I definitely recommend to get.Great atmosphere. Strangers sit beside one another on the tables with six chairs. If you don't mind sharing tables with others, this place is wonderful for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. The Flat Iron Steak with Peppercorn sauce

BqdXjcG3gjLW6vuM3D7mpg.text: I really want to give some background for these 5-stars. Apologies for the long form. Shorter, go eat this frickin' steak.My grandfather was a US Navy Seabee during WWII. Post-war this meant a long career as a boilermaker, traveling the world and throwing down local fare. One impressionable 70s stop, Buenos Aires and a trip inland for a gaucho meat feast. Result: I distinctly recall standing on a saw dust floor, in butcher shop outside Akron, Ohio in 1974 while my grandfather tried to negotiate the purchase of exotic, almost forbidden, flank steak. Like all Depression-era Americas, he regarded steak as a treat, a Sunday dinner if you were impossibly lucky. We did not play. Steak was serious business.I started cooking steak when I was about 13, around the same time that a trip to visit uncles in Arizona revealed the wonders of fresh steak fired over pits of mesquite. Simple beef, sweet smoke, and huge portions. Other highlights over the years: the Amish market outside DC with glistening, hours-old cuts which almost spoke to you; a Ruth Chris creamed spinach side that completely blew away its overpriced, butter-laden steak farce; a chilly, cold ranch outside Flagstaff, forgotten in time. Steak not.So given the glowing reviews of the joint, I was hopeful about Flat Iron, but far, far from convinced. And UK friends, understand this had nothing to do with locale, much more to do with rampant, universal, and uninformed steak hype. To maximize the positive vibe tho, we timed to hit this location slightly past the lunch rush. So, frankly, were the meal a bust, we could adjust. Twenty minutes after checking in, our party of four landed in the tiny (by US standards) but woody and warm space looking to get our steak on. And unless there is burger special on, your choice is -- a flat iron steak. Just do it. Order it no more than medium (medium rare is the sweet spot) and add a sauce -- peppercorn is great, the house Bearnaise sublime. Make sure you get the house cup o salad with an insane mustard dressing and -- well, the chips are wonderfully non-greasy and dip into the Bearnaise with EVIL ease, but for me the chopped, near minced, creamed spinach was a vital side. Sweet jebus.Contrasted with the rich, meaty char of the flat iron, the spinach was amazing. None of the bitter, herbal taste you can get with spinach, yet all of the earthy iron. Oh, earthy rich iron? Hello beef on beef flat iron -- prepped with just enough salt to make it zing without covering up the natural sweetness of this high-grade cut. Zero waste, zero fat, zero complaints. My grandfather would be jealous. That's all I got.

M5MI-7dPicJL99tyltAFog.text: Unbelievable value and great flavors. Definitely get a sauce (I prefer the peppercorn).

y8eJ3OsHcpyD1NJZ-esA7Q.text: Beautifully cooked Flat iron steak. Super value. Restaurant has great ambience for date or bite to eat with friends. Too small for a work dinner really. 15 minute wait and they text you when they're ready. Bernaise sauce was infinitely better than 'Freds' Sauce. Best steak I've ever bought for £10 in a restaurant.

xZ-xlHmAclaSG4exF-wqZQ.text: As far as I'm concerned Flat Iron does the best steak in London! I've probably been 4 or 5 times and every time the service is second to none. I always opt for the £10 steak, creamed spinach and chips. You could say I'm predictable but when you find a combo that is so good, you just have to stick with it! I like my steak rare and Flat Iron cook it to perfection. The meat cleaver shaped knife adds to the experience as does the overall style of the restaurant.I've been to two of the locations and from experience have found the Covent Garden location has more space so is easier to get a table. That being said as you can't book, I always say to my friends that whoever gets there first has to put our names down for a table. It seems to work quite well and there are loads of places to grab a drink in Covent Garden or you can grab a drink at the bar.My only tiny criticism is that a couple of times at the end of our meal we've been given mini meat cleaver tokens for ice cream but alas its not gluten-free. However, the Flat Iron team always let me keep the mini cleaver that I fashioned into earrings for a fancy dress party. Seriously this place won't disappoint!

hfukh2mTbSDCdRiJuPNvag.text: Fairly good food to be honest.Perhaps it would be good to have a bit more choice but certainly the menu choices are very tasty and I think it's definitely a good option for lunch or dinner i you are in Soho!

Chances are you will have to wait to get in so make sure to give them your number and try a espresso martini next door in soho grind while you wait.

QQHHx4RMlEYJrimE1jIKtQ.text: So I went to Flat Iron after hearing many many people go on about it. So one evening both myself and the better half decided to give it a go.The result- He was impressed and had already started planning our next meal there. I on the other hand was a little disappointed and concluded that apart from it being one of the cheapest steak places i had been too i did not see what the hype was all about.Lets break it down shall we-Positives:Great Value for money I don't think its possible to get a steak for that value which you are paying here.The menu is simple and to the point the most complex choice you will have to make is what sides that's about it.The staff are efficient, helpful and friendly.Negatives:The wait before you even enter the establishment.The quality of the food could have been better I left feeling like i was missing something.The deco was confusing and the seating arrnagements was not compfrtable. I felt like i was intruding on the people sitting next to me.

o5IvVJt3jWhJj9vuDjIfNQ.text: The steak was amazing!! It was also very affordable. I got the spinach & cream and chips on the side. You might think I'm crazy, but definitely try dipping your chips in the spinach&cream. Also, once we were seated, they gave us a cup of popcorn to start off which was super unique.

hGmknqmVkzNb84ABVgMIaA.text: If you're in the area and fancy a steak (when do you not fancy a steak?) then you have to come here. They operate a no reservations policy, but in a good way. Here's what you do:1. Decide you want steak (if you haven't already) 2. Go to flat iron, tell them "I would like steak please" or something to that effect 3. They will either give you a table, or take your number and call you when it's free4. Go to the pub and enjoy a delicious beverage (Red Lion round the corner is cheap and cheerful) 5. Receive their phone call 6. Enjoy a delicious steak They only do one thing really, Flat Iron steak, as well as their special steak of the day. You can also order a variety of sides which are all really good too, though to be honest it's the steak that stuck in my mind. The atmosphere was relaxed and quite communal. We were sat on a bench between two other couples. It wasn't the most intimate, but I didn't go there for intimate. As long as you're good with that, you'll be happy. Like I said, pop in here if you're in the area (and fancy steak).

OXZPpOOQDTltiPzlK2wNWg.text: The steak was ok. I ordered medium rare, and it was not easy to chew. The price was definitely affordable, but I was still expecting something better after waiting an hour in line. Fries was over cooked. It looked brown, and was greasy. Creamed spinach was heavy.

4RT9cAwUtpftQrqt436YUg.text: OMG this place is heaven in every bite! can not say enough of the taste and quality of their food! Local produce delight! the menu had our mouth watering the moment we sat down in the cozy communal style table. judging from our fellow dinners plates which were licked clean this was the place to be. went with the special of the night with a side of creamed spinach and salad. Asking what plate was my favorite is like asking which child is your favorite.... come on! being the last night of a wonderful holiday, i splurged and got the salted caramel mouse and swooned with every mouthful. not too sweet and fluffy as can be! can't wait for my next London return to this place!

OIseOqKk0GbipOgfVYjHgQ.text: Recently opened in Soho, Flat Iron is a great new steak house in London. Located off Regent's Street and just around the corner of Carnaby Street, the restaurant is right in the middle of a busy area in central London. You might find it a bit dark and quirky, but it is a very fine little place. The interior is simple, a bit industrial with its brick walls, but really warm and welcoming. The slightly unusual knives underline the uniqueness of this steak house. The menu is as simple as the interior. Basically, you do not have much choice. You actually do not have any choice: the only main is a flat iron steak for £10. Flat Iron is not only the name of the restaurant, but as I learnt from one of the blokes there, also the cut they use for their steaks  and because this cut is not yet very popular in Europe, Flat Iron can offer its superb steaks for a budget price. Briefly after I was seated, I got some water and also popcorn. Yes, no boring bread, but delicious popcorn in a mug! Later came the steak, with a nice leaf salad and chips. I was not sure what I should expect from a relatively cheap steak, but it tasted simply delicious. It was cooked medium, as I requested, was very juicy with a strong meaty flavour and looked just beautiful on the black stone plate. The crispy crust with some salt on top made a fine finish. The chips smelled very intensively and were really crunchy, just as I like it. Despite I am not a big fan of salad, I quite liked the leaf salad with its dressing. I decided to take the Fred's sauce, after I could taste a bit from a nice neighbour. It adds a bit of a sharp punch but easily overpowers the flavour of the steak, so I did not eat too much of it. As of now, they do not yet offer any desserts. But when I asked for one, I was told they are working on something. I guess, this is just another reason to come back soon. In summary, the food at Flat Iron tastes great, and at this price, I am inclined to say that it is probably the best steak one can buy in central London for a tenner. Flat Iron offers quality steaks in a relaxed and friendly atmosphere. Definitely another central London restaurant I will visit again.
